One quick note is a memory that will stay with us forever,during our time there we were attacked every day by a little bird who was nesting in the surrounding trees and fauna of the pool,despite the best efforts of the brilliant garden staff to locate and remove him and his family (due to some miserable guests)he remained and provided entertainment all the time we were poolside,truly hilarious to watch big guys (6ft plus) dodging this tiny but determined little bird!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: midoriyo
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view of Mission Bay. The room was spacious and clean. It had 2 queen beds and a sitting area with a sofa bed and coffee table. There was also another table with an ethernet cable on it. The hotel has free WiFi, but the WiFi was really slow when using my laptop. My iPhone kept dropping the signal. I ended up giving up when using my phone and just used 3G instead. We were most surprised that the on-site restaurant, Firefly, was really good. We went for lunch when we first arrived to San Diego and sat outside, overlooking the marina. Everything we ate was delicious. We went again for dinner on the last night of our stay. Again, we had a great meal and sat outside. Another bonus is that you can see the fireworks at SeaWorld from the pool area. I would stay at this hotel again because of its comfortable rooms, the yummy, convenient restaurant, and its proximity to San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Room small, location o.k., pool very nice”
Reviews.Author: Aline0412
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 teens) slept in one room in the Dana and that was not very comfortable. The room was too small for that. The location is o.k., walking distance (15 minutes) to the beach and a busstop in front of the hotel to go to the Gaslamp District. The Dana has a nice pool to relax for a moment.

Reviews.Title: “good location for cousin's reunion”
Reviews.Author: calteacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful grounds and a great location situated right on the bay. There is a free shuttle from hotel to Sea World. It is also a nice walk to Sea World. The rooms are comfortable and good size with balconies in the new sections. Service in the reception area was slow but always pleasant. Breakfast in the Pearl (part of the hotel) was reasonably priced and quite good.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back, just not here”
Reviews.Author: popcornlover51
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned yesterday from a 4 day vacation at the Dana and for those of you who are thinking about staying here, let me share my thoughts. Pros: our room (premium bay view 2 Queens w/balcony) was much better than expected. We were in AW! upon entry as we couldn't believe how spacious and bright it was.You have use of a robe and 2 towels for your use of there pools. Be far warned... it's not yours to keep. It must be returned to the hotel if not, there's a costly charged to your credit card. The bathroom was spacious but could have been a tad bit cleaner. There was hair on the floor and ceiling. Nothing to complain about though. In the lobby you have free use of the internet as well as printing out your boarding passes etc. Free shuttle service to sea world and early morning coffee/newspaper. You can rent a bike for $8.00 and hour or more etc. Cons:_( Our room (as lovely as it was) was extremely pricey(a room in the water's edge section) They add ridiculous amounts of incidentials once you receive your final bill at check out. Also, there were unsupervised underaged teens having loud parties in which we didn't get a peaceful nights sleep. We noticed food trays left in hallway. Garbage/pizza boxes plus empty soda bottles thrown on the side of the garbage cans. I don't know where the parents/guardians were, but you can bet the teens were left alone to cause major chaos. In conclusion, If you enjoy being near the marina and you're a water/boating person, this is the perfect hotel for you. We didn't realize this as this is our very first time visiting the state of California. Besides, we don't care to stay at the same place twice.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Dana When I visit San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Caitsgrden
Reviews.Content: Great spot, nice clean rooms. beautiful pool. great service. I have stayed there 3 times and will definitely go back! The Location is awesome, close to the beaches; rooms are nice, well appointed. Paying for parking is a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay right on the bay.”
Reviews.Author: azatc
Reviews.Content: Stayed there to escape Arizona heat last two summers. The bay view rooms are awesome. Very pleased with the service and cleanliness. Could not be better unless it was right on the beach, but being right on the bay was great. A special thank you to Jennifer K. Plan to return every summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shr26
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed The Dana. Our double-Queen room was spacious enough for two adults and two kids. The free shuttle to Sea World was a fantastic bonus. The front desk staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, and the grounds are beautifully maintained. The food at the on-site Blue Pearl restaurant was tasty and reasonably priced (especially considering it is a hotel restaurant, which tend to be over-priced), the food arrived quickly--always a plus when travelling with kids--and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbmoberg
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful view of the water, access to boats and kayaks and a very nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: dogbark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7 nights with my girlfriend and her son(age 12) and another couple and their 2 kids(2-6) Everyone loved it! Our first night we had a courtyard level room and the courtyard by the tropical pool is beautiful, but it was a tad too small for the 3 of us for a week, plus we could hear the people above us stomping around. Usually I can tolerate occasional noise, but these rooms have older AC units and the combo of the foot stompers and loud AC was enough to change rooms. The next day we went to the front desk and they moved us to the newer section, which is made of concrete and quieter. We paid $40 a night for the upgrade, but the room was larger, with a view of the bay and worth the extra $$! By the way, the front desk crew was very nice and accomodating to us our whole stay. We ate breakfast at the Blue Pearl a few times and it was pretty descent. Lunch was ok. We had 3 meals at the Firefly and they were excellent. We were very happy with the quality of the food and service! The pools are nice(towels provided in the room), with wait service at the pool by the firefly and a cabana-type bar at the tropical pool. San Diego has so much to offer, but you can easily stay at this hotel and not leave(as long as you're willing to run a tab) Since there's a marina behind the Dana, you can rent jet skis, paddle boats, pontoon and ski boats, etc. I'd recomend this hotel for families, friends,and couples old and young. The staff is friendly, food good, rooms are nice, and you can't beat the location to Sea World, the beach ,downtown and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing and Memorable Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: cvanstelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were taking a much needed vacation in San Diego. We wanted something fun but relaxing in a beautiful location. The Dana Hotel is all of those things and MORE! First off, you just cannot beat the location. It is set on beautiful Mission Bay and our room overlooked the bay full of jet skiers, kayakers and boaters. We rented bikes and took a short trip to the Boardwalk which is full of fun nightlife and cool restaurants. Also, the hotel property is full of luscious trees and flower beds with two pools. The one pool we went to was rather large and had cabana shade you could sit under for no extra charge. It is a great place to take a nap or read a book. The other pool we never made it but it is located next to a beautiful garden and had a sandbox for kids to play in. It also had a snack bar that serves drinks :) There were two days that we didn't even leave the property. We just hung out at the pool and ate at the hotel. Second, the rooms are beautiful. The beds are comfortable and the decor is relaxing. Water in the shower stays warm and the shower head gives a strong flow. (with curly hair this is a must :) ) The housekeeping staff keeps the room super clean and restocks all towels and robes quickly. The last and rather important aspect is the wonderful restaurants and staff at the Dana. We loved breakfast at the Blue Pearl which has really reasonable prices and AMAZING eggs benedict! We also loved the Firefly because not only does it serve the BEST creme brulee ever the staff is so friendly. My husband and I would get drinks there and chit chat with the wonderful ladies behind the bar. Basically, when I go back to San Diego, I know I will be staying at the Dana and I know we will have an incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: barbk2142
Reviews.Content: We splurged and spent the extra money for an upper level room overlooking Mission Bay. It was worth every penny. Spacious, clean room, large bathroom, microwave, sink and 'fridge, with balcony and patio furniture. Very pleasantly surprised by the quality of food at the onsite restaurant "Firefly". Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Our home, away from home”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy6513
Reviews.Content: We have spent 6 summer vacations at The Dana and a few days throughout the year as well. It's exciting to arrive, check in, unpack and begin our stay, but it is so heartbreaking and hard to leave The Dana. It is the entire staff that makes The Dana such a wonderful, excellent and memorable place to stay. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Splurge for the bay view rooms”
Reviews.Author: ekb3033
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick 3 night getaway to San Diego. We chose the Dana for its central location, and booked through Southwest to get the mileage points. The bay view rooms were more expensive, but were very nice, and had gorgeous views. We watched the sun set over the water every evening. The room had a small kitchenette with a sink, mini fridge, coffee maker, and cabinets stocked with plastic plates and bowls. The pool and hot tub were very nice, and made for a perfect place to watch the Sea World fireworks every night. Of the 2 restaurants on location, Firefly is the best. Good service and very good food, including fresh seafood. We went to the Blue Pearl for breakfast and it was just so-so. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions, maps, and recommendations. The only bummer is paying $18/day to park, but this seems pretty standard these days. I would definitely stay at the Dana again!

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth $$”
Reviews.Author: fire860
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay the rooms are just not what you pay for. Everything is old, the ac is on the floor and your breath blows harder then it does, bathroom so tiny. We stay here one night, and then moves to pacific Terrance now that's the place don't waste your money because its in the bay, just not worth it.. promise. Shuttle was nice to sea world front desk girls they act like you are wasting their time..

Reviews.Title: “our favorite get away”
Reviews.Author: marieferrantello
Reviews.Content: perfect place to stay, never have to leave the hotel. the pool, the amazing landscaping, & the over all atmosphere were incredible. the restraunts, the food, the service, amazing. great staff, would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: newfriendseverywhere
Reviews.Content: We were shocked that for a hotel that cost this much the room was typical of an $80/night hotel, the place was in need of upkeep, they charged $18/day for parking (in a place with ample parking and not accessible by public transportation), and the continental breakfast (juice/coffee/2 pieces of toast/fruit cup) cost $10. This was so overpriced and so not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Most welcoming and relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: 4TravelersMT
Reviews.Content: The minute we drove in to the property I knew it was the right choice! The grounds were absolutely gorgeous, the staff was most friendly and our room quite comfortable, although the bath area was small. The 2 pools were the highlight for the kids and the casual outdoor seating at the restaurant overlooking the pool was just right for me! Great menu at both restaurants. The buildings reminded me of the 1960's, nicely updated and the Marina was such a special site. Definitely a great choice at a great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel to stay in on Mission Beach in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: AWin64
Reviews.Content: We love The Dana. We come back to this hotel every year in the summer and we love it. We stay in the new buliding section/rooms with bay view. The rooms are very spacious and have two queen beds. There is a kitchenette as well. The rooms are alway very clean and updated. Housekeeping leaves a robe and towels for us to use if we decide to go to the pool. The balcony is very large has the best view of the bay. Also, this is the best location if you want to be close to the beach, but don't want the noise and traffic. We sent our kids for one week to the Sea World Camp (which the hotel has a shuttle to/from) while on vacation. I highly recommend this hotel. We travel all over the world and stay in the most amazing resorts, but the Dana is just one of those places we always love to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTElliot
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel. From the moment we pulled in, to checking out, the hotel staff were very pleasant. Our room was BEAUTIFUL and exactly what we needed. Our view from the room was magnificent, the pools were fabulous, the room service was well priced and the food was good. The Firefly Restaurant had amazing food as well. It is the perfect location for anyone (especially with kids) going to the Zoo, Safari park, or Sea World (which is literally across the street!) My husband, our 2 kids and I couldn't have asked for anything more, and we cannot wait to book another trip.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back again.”
Reviews.Author: nanawatson
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at The Dana. WE spent our honeymoon and our second anniversary at The Dana. I would highly recommend it to anyone including families with children. They have two great restaurants, two pools and wonderful rooms with a view of San Diego Mission Bay. WE enijoyed sitting on the balcony in the mornings and watching the crews row and the boats going out to sea to fish. It is a great way to start the day. The rooms are very comfortable with all the amenities anyone needs. The service is subperb.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected, Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bwhitese
Reviews.Content: Pros - Nice Pool for the Kids, WIthin walking distance to Seaworld and Mission Beach. Comfortable beds. Cons- Rooms (In the Older Buildings) are very small, not enough room for 2 adults and 2 kids and suitcases, Walls are very thing, If someone next door puts their lock out to keep the door open, it will wake you up if you are trying to sleep because the door slams shut. Check your bill extra careful when checking out. Had a $70 breakfast charge that was not ours and $138 charge for 2 adult seaworld tickets that was suppose to be included in our room package. TV didn't work, so they fixed it but then it did not have any sound. Maid service did not clean our room one of the 4 days we stayed there. Was not worth the $$$ that they charge to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Deception at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: BrutJimmy
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at the Dana in Nov. 2010 on business. I stayed in the bay side 2 Queen room which was clean but overpriced for the time of year. I again booked a 2 queen room for 6 days in late June 2011 and this time got stuck in a 2 queen room overlooking the marina and boy was that a complete dump. The room smelled of old musty shoes, absolutley no room to put your luggage, and the advertised "Queen" beds, are simply full size. The only thing in that room that was queen was the headboard. The bed was about 6 inches narrower than the headboard. In addition, bring your own pillows because they are simply old stuffed rags in a pillow case. I went to the front desk to complain about it and the blond genius looked at me as if I was speaking a foreign language and simply said "All our beds are queen size". How can you argue with logic like that? Simply put. The Dana needs major renevation. The photos on their website are completely deceptive. This place is an overpriced dump on the water. I do not recommend this hotel to anybody and I would not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location on the bay. Can walk to Seaworld.”
Reviews.Author: dmritter
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights while visting San Diego. The location is great. The bay is beautiful. It was an easy walk from SeaWorld. The restaurants and pools were nice. I was not pleased that I could not get wi fi to work while I was there but overall it is a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Keep Secret in SD. LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: 1026jen
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem. This is the perfect place for families and couples. It has something for everyone and the staff is great. Movies and a mini beach area for kids at one pool. Music and drinks on the bay at the other pool. Not short staffed. The food at the Firefly for lunch and dinner (on site) was beyond amazing. Had two of the best meals in a long time here and for the price this whole place is a steal. Bar tender makes real drinks not watered down. Watched staff attended to every detail to help make a brides dreams come true and SeaWorld fireworks just after dinner pool side at the Dana. Rooms are super clean, staff super friendly super relaxing and in a great location. Absolute, heaven pool side.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time and plan to return.”
Reviews.Author: Gloryj
Reviews.Content: From arrival to leaving the service was prompt and friendly. Our room had a patio and view of the Bay which was lovely. The room was fresh, attractive and very clean. It was a plus to have the mini bar/kitchen. The two restaurants, pools and available water sports on site completed the tropical resort atmosphere. Best: The location so near the city and attractions, yet so spacious and relaxed. Least: None.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lzmOverlandPark_KS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Bayside room for our 25th wedding anniversary. BEAUTIFUL view, quiet, clean room, amazing setting. Selected based on Trip Advisor reviews, and a package with Southwest, and the hotel and grounds actually exceeded our expectations. Highly recommend; would love to go back. Just one negative: $18/per day to park is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Another great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Ro
Reviews.Content: 2 colleagues and I stayed at the Dana because the hotel for our conference was full. I have to say, views were mixed. One colleague wasn't happy (perhaps at the lack of support for his vegetarian diet?), the other was kind of neutral -- and I really liked it! Everything just worked for me ... the wireless internet, the great view of the bay, the great location to see the fireworks ... kids in the nearby pool playing happily, but not raucous ... what's not to like? "Truth in advertising" compels me to say that the rooms could do with a little updating, and the coffee shop was OK for the price but not amazing (but then we never tried the upscale restaurant). I'm really loving San Diego though ... old-style high-style at the Del Coronado, upscale business lodgings at the Manchester Grand Hyatt, and fair-value accomodations with a bit of charcter at the Dana and the Catamaran ... this city has something for everyone. What would compel me to pick the Dana over all the others? If my vacation was Seaworld-focused, this would definitely be the pick!

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, slow service”
Reviews.Author: bekeles
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude and the service was slow. The rooms were OK but it was terribly overpriced especially for what we got. Our room was supposed to have a view of the bay, however, instead we were looking out onto a public park which had a couple homeless people hanging out (which of course is fine, but not what I was picturing when I go on vacation). Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but will not return”
Reviews.Author: lvs2trvl2gether
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at The Dana. The first was this time last year and we loved it so much that we wanted to go back. We we not as impressed. Our room again had a fantastic view but the people below us were smokers and we could smell it from our room. You are not allowed to smoke in your room and they have designated areas however these particular people did not care. Then they had the nerve to tell my son to stop making noise while he played on the balcony. My other frustration was on our 3rd night, the plumbing started leaking in the kitchenette so we had to have maintence come up, it was after 10pm. Also we had ants, just a few and we were able to control what we did see but we contacted the front and the guy acted like it was our fault. He said that they have never received a complaint like that and asked if we had food out. WHAT? how rude. The maintence guy came up to spray but my husband had to actually show him where to look, he didnt even know what he was looking for. Also parking is an extra $18.00 a day...ouch and they do not even offer a lot of it (at least on the water's edge side), the spaces are small and the water from the sprinklers are constantly hitting the car doors. I do have to say that the location is great, just minutes from Mission Beach and right across from Sea World. Great for the kids and the shuttle is awsome. I love the drivers they are so friendly. The Blue Pearl resturant is sooo good and the prices are not bad. The servers are also very nice. The other resturant, the FireFly, not so good and way overpriced for the amount of food they serve. We never actually made it to ethier of the pools on both trips to The Dana but they look very apealing. We were always just so busy with doing other things. All in all, we will probably not be going back but are happy that we did have one good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite location, numerous visit”
Reviews.Author: ULIKEDERF
Reviews.Content: We love the Dana! My wife and I have stayed there for our anniversary and my basketball team went to San Diego this last spring for a tournament and we had 4 rooms at that time. The staff was great, the rooms are great and the view was to die for. The pool is always clean and welcoming, the beds are comfotable and the food was tasty. We will be back. I can't imagine staying in San Diego and not using the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: messahb
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough great things about the Dana. In fact, part of me wants to keep this little gem all to myself so I can return any time without facing a sold-out situation. Another part of me wants to shout it out to all the families with young children how great it is. It's location, close to airport, on the bay, across from Sea World and close to a market is perfect. The hotel staff smothered us in service to the point that it became a joke among us, "I bet they're calling to make sure we got our towels...yup - that was it". The courtyard rooms, are small but fantastic for both children and parents. Children can run around in the enclosed courtyard while parents can relax or get ready. This feature afforded me the luxury of actually being able to relax for the first time in a long time. I was impressed with The Blue Pearl restaurant with its great service, prices and decent food. I wouldn't recommend renting a car considering the parking fee and the fact that you can do so from the front desk they day before you need it. The only bummer is that there's no kiddie pool but there is a gigantic sand pit with toys. The Dana is affordable and totally awesome and I pray to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: SteveNGini
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana with our family of 9 people. Rooms were beautiful and very comfortable. Bay view suites which offered great view of Mission Bay and sail boats etc. Staff was very polite and helpful. Food at the Blue Pearl restaurant for breakfast was good, but service was slow, needs more wait staff. Pool was perfect for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Cool staff and shuttle to seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: Freakydeaky31
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay here cause everything is so convenient I dont need to rent a car and the view is killer. Front desk, shuttle drivers and house keeping are all super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suite!”
Reviews.Author: Haloman99
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at The Dana for a little mini getaway. It was a beautiful hotel - tropical landscaping, right on the bay. We paid a little more and stayed in a beautiful spa suite. It worked out really well. Able to put the toddler down for bed and then enjoy the rest of the evening in the living room. The suite had a huge balcony and a view of the bay. Loved it. Our daughter enjoyed both pools and we couldn't keep her away from the statue of the kids. Got some great pictures! Front desk staff was very knowledgeable about the area and loved the free shuttle to SeaWorld. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: 3lilkays
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with our stay here. We stayed in one of the older rooms facing the pool. It was a little on the small side, but we were travelling with three little kids. We have a lot of stuff and we weren't in the room that much. It was very clean and the beds comfortable. The location was wonderful, easy access to everything and the most beautiful views. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MireilleSB
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Dana for one week, the hotel is not that big but it is nice and the location is great! customer service is very good and the staff are friendly. There is an outdoor swimming pool and a jacuzzi which is very nice. I recommend this hotel for a business trip and not for a honeymoon...as one can find much bigger hotels but it is up to your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is an A++”
Reviews.Author: dfarrell2
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is an A++ Home is where the heart is. The Dana is my other home! Their staff treats you like family. Facility and cost is also well worth it. Great views of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne_Dubois
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, and enjoyed their "bigger" rooms at a little higher price. In hindsight, we spent very little time in the room and would have been fine staying somewhere less expensive, but it was still nice. The bathroom was newly remodeled and had nice floors and decor. I liked their green-friendly approach, including lotions and shampoo, etc in cardboard/paper containers instead of plastic bottles. We could hear through the walls a bit, and at one point the guests in the room beside us smacked the wall very loudly, I guess it was his little way to suggest we turn down the tv volume. It was kind of rude, and I didn't think the tv was very loud, but later when I wanted to sleep I thought the people above us were too loud. I think the walls are just a bit too thin. The pool was nice and we enjoyed a view of the fireworks over Sea World each night at 10pm. Our stay included $10 credit at the bar (didn't care for my pina colada, too sweet) and $20 credit each morning for breakfast. Breakfast was very good both days and everyone was happy. the grounds are nice, and I was glad to find a computer with internet for guest use. the concierege was not helpful regarding activities or suggestions, but we found our own way and thoroughly enjoyed San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: pat_vanleene
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay is perfectly located for a city trip to San Diego, close to Sea World and The Old Town. There is a free shuttle from the hotel to Sea World. The staff is efficient and very friendly. Have a frozen mojito on the patio of its Fire Fly bar with a view of the marina and you'll feel quite close to paradise. Patrick, Marysa & Dennis

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: traveltosun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a girlfriend for the Rock N Roll San Diego Marathon. Perfect location as it was less than a mile from the finish. I vacation frequently and I love springing for a waterfront complex when I'm able to. The bayside location was wonderful! The main pool is large & overlooks the marina, which was an added bonus. Did not seem too crowded but did notice the beach chairs were lacking as they were all full. We stayed in the old section, which was perfectly fine for us. We had a ground floor room with a patio that overlooked the pool, however the foilage was too thick to view the pool. It was a tad dark in the room but provided some great afternoon shade when relaxing on the patio. The room size worked out fine for us, but I definately would not recommend these rooms for families as they could get cramped with 3 or 4 people. I was very impressed by how clean and updated the rooms were & with all of the ammenities, including robes! We ate at both restaurants, and definately preferred Fire Fly. Blue Pearl was "o.k.", but more of a upscale Denny's feel. Great for families I suppose, but not really the atmosphere two adult gals were looking for. Food was also just "o.k.". The food and the atmosphere of Fire Fly were much better. It is located next to the pool & bay, so we were able to watch the fireworks from our dinner table! I agree with the reviewer who commented on how early they close. Would be nice if they stayed open until at least 11 p.m., especially this time of year. Only two complaints were 1) We were overcharged for drinks once, and they tried to overcharge us two more times, but we caught it. Apparently, they introduced their new Spring 2011 menu but failed to input the new reduced prices in their computer. Once we pointed it out they charged us correctly. 2) The paid shuttle service the hotel provided to get race participants to the start line 6-7 miles away. I was very concerned that the 5:30 a.m. schedule deparure time was not going to allow us enough time to get to the start line before 6:15. I was reassured over & over by the hotel representative that it would. Sure enough, the shuttle never showed up & about 2 dozen runners were still standing around at the hotel 10 minutes before the race start. The manager finally came out & payed all of our cab fares to the start line, but it still created a fiasco. Nothing is worse than getting to the start line as the gun is blowing off with no time to stretch, mentally prepare, etc. Not cool! The hotel did send out an apology and refunded our shuttle fee, but still a pretty stressful situation for us runners. Oh, and yes, the parking charge is ridiculous. This is one of my HUGE pet peeves, when hotels charge you to stay there & then tack on a over inflated parking fee. It's really, really tacky. Even with these couple of issues I would still highly recommend The Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but a 3 star hotel rooms!l”
Reviews.Author: momcyn
Reviews.Content: Enough can't be said about the beautiful location of The Dana. It really can't be beat! The hotel is situated right on the marina with many rooms facing the waterfront. It's a 15 minute walk to SeaWorld and you get a picture perfect view of the fireworks from the marina! The only downside are the age and wear and tear of the rooms. We were misled by false advertising on the Internet because all of the photos on the website are of the new wing of the property. A majority of the rooms (8 buildings worth) are older. They were recently updated, but essentially they are an upgraded version of a motel room. They are tight and extremely small for any family with kids. Our room was also noisy facing the road and parking lot! My kids woke up several times due to garbage trucks and utility trucks backing up into the property. People could be heard talking loudly in their rooms and outside. You will most definitely be booked in the older rooms if you book through any of the discounted websites like Priceline or Hotels.com. I believe the only sure way to secure a new room is to book directly through the hotel and pay the premium rate. Also be aware of the $18 daily parking fee. That said, my family and I thoroughly enjoyed the grounds and especially the Pool facing the marina. It was absolutely beautiful, well heated, and an infinity pool so the water (salt water) lapped up onto the sides of the pool. This was a nice and luxurious touch! Overall, if we got an excellent deal again we would stay at The Dana for the location and pool experience.

Reviews.Title: “Re Consider Booking”
Reviews.Author: PHOENIX1226
Reviews.Content: Reserved the higher priced marina view". Actually, the door opened to the parking lot. There is a much nicer and newer section of the hotel, but that was never offered. The standard or marina view were all that was offered. Had room service, good fair price. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, The Blue Pearl. AWFUL, AWFUL. Never brought us water, asked 3 times. Asked for cream for coffee. It was brought in a small glass pitcher, which was full of salt! Poured it in coffee and almost choked. No apology, no nothing, Slow service. Pool showers not working, no bathrooms at pool. Small rooms. Noisy because of parking lot location. Good location, but, re consider booking at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “"We can't wait to return, and bring more family."”
Reviews.Author: Shiney96
Reviews.Content: My Grandaughter's Godmother wanted to take her to Seaworld for her 5th birthday, she lives in So Cal and we live in AZ, so we decided to meet in San Diego. The Dana came highly recommended by fellow Arizonians so we tried it. We were so pleased with the location, the accomodations, service, food, and the warmth of the staff. This was a girls trip but can't wait to take my husband and meet up with other friends at The Dana. I honestly don't think you can do better, especially if you're bringing children. The grounds, the pool, sandbox, all so much fun. We booked a courtyard level so we even had a patio.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time there ... and only one minor complaint”
Reviews.Author: NJPel
Reviews.Content: As petty as it is, I didn;t think that the Dana should be charging a parking fee. Memorial weekend and I had to pay for parking for 4 nights ... meanwhile there was a wedding there and the gates were open all day for the wedding party ? If they insist on charging for parking, at least hide it in the cost of the room to make it feel like you are not getting hit for the little extras. Other than that, the hotel was nice again ... However, I sure wish we were in the newer section

Reviews.Title: “Our New Place To Stay In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaLaxman
Reviews.Content: Had a pool side room in the old section,was very convienent for the pool. We had our own table and chairs. Our only minus was the sink,fridge,and microwave made for no counter space for all our bathroom products. The Blue Pearl restaurant was inexpensive,friendly and fast.The Fire Fly we ate at the last night on our 3 night stay,service was good,the food was just average. There was a wedding so maybe that was the reason for the filet mignon being over cooked and over all average meal,with the exception of desert.They through in a free desert for over cooking the steak and it was excellent.We will be back. The Andersons

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: EllenW28
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location and planned on staying 2 nights and leaving. We stayed 4 nights and loved everything about it. From the minute we checked in, we were greeted with a smile and offer to assist in anyway possible. Upon entering our room, 3rd floor balcony, I immediately noticed the cleanliness and functionality as superb. The wireless service was included, (rare at most hotels) and the robes and large pool towels were an added bonus. We wer offered a shuttle to visit Sea World, free, making it simple to not worry about parking. The pools were very clean and the grounds beautiful. My only complaint was the restaurants. Not the best choices, but just okay. We found wonderful restaurants close by, recommended by the waiter at the hotel! The bar was awesome, very friendly. Even though NY and Calif. is a six hour plane ride, I do plan on returning to San Diego, and will definately be staying at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach, close to the fireworks, close to good food”
Reviews.Author: ArchieVBRJ
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego over spring break for a sunny getaway for our family. Upon arrival at the Dana, we were greeted by friendly staff, who continued to be helpful throughout our whole trip. We are a family of five and the two queen room was too small. But, it was ok because there was so much to do on the Dana Resort grounds, such as two large swimming pools and hot tubs, ping-pong, volleyball, bike and boat rentals and outstanding food. We dined at the Firefly and the Blue Pearl. We were able to walk to Mission Beach, Belmont Park and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “tension relief”
Reviews.Author: pacificajr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quality, relaxing, scenic stay, this would be the place. But you must take advantage of the "Deluxe" accommodations over looking Mission Bay. You are minutes from anywhere, Mission Beach, Pacific Beach are a brief drive away and downtown, old town, just a short freeway drive. Enjoy the hot tub, and lounge by the pool. Look forward to a refreshment at the Firefly lounge. For us, a glass of wine in our room as we enjoyed the sunset and watched the boats from our balcony over looking the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAhotwax
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price and really nice. We had 3 adults and one 12 year old. There was a lot of room. To be on ground level and have a patio with a gate was great. We could walk right outside and see the water was really nice. The shuttle bus was great to go to Sea World. The resturants were great for a hotel. The two pools were nice. Well worth the money. The staff were so friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: RKR2010
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband to San Diego for a surprise 30th Birthday trip. We stayed at the Dana for 4 nights and were extremely happy with our stay. The front desk staff were incredible - they helped me pre-arrange birthday balloons & M&M's in our room before we arrived, and arranged a rental convertible for us through Enterprise. They were always helpful in providing directions and suggesitions for wherever we wanted to go. The hotel is really close to Sea World, we walked there and back. We also rented bikes and rode to the beach. The pool and hot tubs were great, the hotel restaurant was fairly priced for breakfast, and the Mixologist behind the bar at Firefly was more than happy to mix new shots for us. Our room was in the older building, but looking out over the marina. It was perfect for us, very comfortable bed, good sized bathroom, and we loved how the room smelled like oak. Overall, we had a GREAT time at the Dana and would definitely be back and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Deceptive.....Not as advertised!!”
Reviews.Author: mande01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend away through hotwire and received a room at Dana on MIssion Bay. Once booked, we called the hotel to see about our reservation and found out that we were booked in the old part of the hotel. Apparently, all hotwire customers are booked in the old part. After reading reviews on the old part, we called the hotel and tried to cancel our reservation. We were unsuccessful. Then we decided to give it a chance. Big mistake. Upon checking in, we were coldly greeted by a very unpersonable front desk worker. We asked to see a room before securing the reservation and our request was ignored. We were told that there were no rooms available in the new part. We were stuck. The room was awful. It was small, dingy, and smelled musty. There was no closet but there was an oversized armoire that when opened, allowed no room to walk. The bathroom was dirty (a stain on the toilet) and had exposed plumbing under the sink and bad patchwork over holes in the door. The door frame missing from the bathroom door and the room carpet was dirty. Many of the advertisements of this "resort" are likely of the new part of the hotel. We would not know though, because we were stuck in the old part. The night we arrived, we checked in at 8pm. We checked out two hours later at 10pm and again exchanged very few words with the same front desk worker. We received no common courtesies from her like, "Sorry for the inconvenience" or "Is there something we can do?" Oh and by the way, this hotel has no amenities like free WiFi, free parking, or free contential breakfast. In fact, the hotel charging $18/night to park there. Rip off! So....now it's 10pm on a Friday night and we have no place to stay. We spent 45 minutes calling around trying to find a hotel that had a decent room at an affordable price. We lucked out and found a room in the Old Town area and will be writing a pleasant review for them.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. Will be back for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: specsdog
Reviews.Content: My husband and teen daughter and I recently spent 3 nights at the Dana in San Diego. Our room was in the watertower building. The hotel room was just as nice as the internet picure if not nicer. The room was extremely clean and very modern and functional. We loved the balcony overlooking Mission Bay. The beds were very comfortable with nice bedding. The front desk service was very efficient and friendly. The maid service was also very effecient. The shuttle service to Sea World and to and from Amtrak was very prompt. The drivers were both very friendly and helpful. We will definately be back to stay at this wonderful hotel when in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “So close to Sea World!”
Reviews.Author: karieck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here thursday-sat! Our reason for coming to this hotel was to be close to Sea World. This hotel had a great deal on rates during this time too! We could literally walk out of our door and see the water/docks/bay! There is a walking trail that takes you all along the bay-gorgeous view! You can also walk to a beach area with sand that is 3/4 of a mile from the hotel. Just up over the bridge. It's an easy drive with great free parking too though! No waves-perfect for babies/toddlers! The Dana offers a shuttle to Sea World which was a huge plus for us. We took the 9:45am shuttle and they arrived right on time. The driver even took all the strollers and folded them down for everyone and packed them in the back-no fuss or stress for families with toddlers/kids! We took the 3:45pm shuttle back and again it arrived right on time! The staff is so friendly and nice! Pools are both heated and one has 3 cabana's to lounge in! Tons of seating! The only negative was the service at FireFly Resturant. They sat us but never came back for drink or food order! After 15 minutes we finally got up and left. I told the hostess that we were leaving and why and she was very snippy! Didn't like that! Their food looked great though! So we went to the other resturant on site! It was very quiet (kind of stressful when you have a toddler) but the food was good. Many families inside eating too! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- clean hotel, doubt I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: lucy294
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you're going to Sea World, and the kids enjoyed the heated pool, while I enjoyed the bay view. My main complaint is the $18 parking, and there is no other place to park, and my room. I had a park view suite, which gave me a lovely view of the homeless guys who live in the park. With two small children and my husband not with us on this trip, I did not feel comfortable leaving the shutters open that faced the park and that was huge sliding glass doors that opened onto a balcony that was in the park. The service in the restaurants was great, but the food was just ok. Would I go back? Probably not, for the price I am sure you could eat better and have a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Gloria035
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana on our recent trip to San Diego with our daughter and her husband and 10 year old twin girls. All of us loved our experience at the Dana - we stayed in the rooms that view Mission Bay. The kids loved the swimming pool and the table tennis. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good and the location was ideal. There is a higher end restaurant at the hotel and although we didn't dine there it looked like a nice place to eat. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we plan on going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dump - Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: fudge23_10
Reviews.Content: We came down to San Diego for a couple of days for the zoo. We have two small children aged 5 and 2. The reviews on Trip Advisor were 78% excellent so I booked two days. Upon arrival I was very disappointed. This is a motel - not a hotel at all. This hotel is old and the furnishings are old, dirty and shabby. The rugs are worn, stained, dirty and lumpy. The walls are unprofessionally painted, smell bad and look bad. The bathroom looks like my Dad "upgraded" with a fake marble top. The pipes are visible. The rooms are not central air but have a wall unit. WTF? There is a large TV with cable. There is no internet service or WiFi. This place was so awful I refused to take off my shoes fearing I would pick up some nasty germs from the floor. We had to stay there as I could not get another room. We stayed gone until we had to sleep. The room rate is deceptive as they tell you there is an $18 per day parking charge which you can't avoid. Deceptive, Dirty, Old, Motel. Never Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Fabulous Food”
Reviews.Author: EVarelas
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! I recently stayed at the Dana with 2 teenagers during a trip to visit colleges. From our room, we had beatutiful views of the bay with close proximity to the fabulous pool and hot tub. The hotel is in centrally located--minutes to all the main attractions, universities, airport and downtowm. Not to mention, a short bike ride to the beach. Teenagers are often tough to please but they loved it. The hidden gem of the Dana is the incredibly accomodating front desk and restaurant staff. The food at the FireFly was some of the best we enjoyed in San Diego. Don't miss the opportunity to enjoy fabulous sea bass underneath the stars. Not to mention the great breakfast at the Blue Pearl. The accomodating staff make sure you are well cared for! We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian style vacation in Southern CA”
Reviews.Author: gjzinmaui
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was so impressed and delighted by The Dana Hotel! The day after I checked out, I was already checking my schedule for another stay there. I loved the tropical landscape and decor. I have lived on Maui and this place reminded me of the island hotels. The view of the Bay and Harbor is gorgeous! it has a nice path for walking skating or biking. I love to kayak so I was thrilled with the easy access to kayak and other water toys and bikes right beside the hotel. My room and bed was so comfy and the maid service was excellent! I enjoyed the food at the restaurants on the grounds of the hotel. The Dana is right next to Sea World and just a short drive or about a mile and a half from the beach. I can't wait to get back there for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, new favorite in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: SGuzman007
Reviews.Content: The service from the moment we arrived was great. Our room faced the bay - great view! Big spacious room, very clean and comfortable! Grounds are very well kept. Pool is very nice with plenty of chairs. Liked it so much, we are going back in June! Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: malm1959
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel for a trip to San Diego. We chose this hotel because it was close to a conference that my husband attended. I was a little worried when we checked in because the carpet outside the hotel room was stained. When we got into the room it was more than adequate. There was a slightly musty smell but we just left the balcony door open and it went away. We took off the bedspread because they had dated polyester spreads. Underneath, they had nice cotton duvet covers, and they would have been nicer with just the covers instead of the spread. The room is good size (bay View) and the bathroom is also fine. The only problem was that the light in the bathroom was on a motion detector and it didnt work, so you had to turn on that light. and it was a little annoying. The restaurant firefly was really good for dinner, I recommend it. The breakfast in the blue pearl was more than adequate. Portions were huge at breakfast. You could easily share. The two pools were very nice, but I sat in the hot tub because the temperature of the water in the pool was a little cool. The view from the room was very nice. But you must remember that this hotel is actually next to and part of a park. As a result, there was a homeless guy that I could see from my room who was sleeping in the park. This is a problem everywhere in San Diego and it was not an issue for our room. However, I was happy that I had a room on the second floor, it just felt safer.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is a wonderful and relaxing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: royalgrl13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Dana for the week last week. Everytime that we come to San Diego, we always choose The Dana. The hotel is always clean and very quiet. I love that the hotel has a family atmosphere and that the staff are always friendly and so willing to help. From the moment that we walk into the lobby to check in, you know that we will receive excallent service. The Blue Pearl and The FireFly have wonderful food. We love to sit on the patio outside of The Firefly and enjoy the nice San Diego weather.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: boysrthebest
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel - it was right on the bay and the decor was great! Perfect for couples or families, it was much more than I expected. It was within a short driving distance to Sea World and shopping. We absolutely loved our stay here. They have 2 separate pool areas and the kids loved swimming here. I would definitely stay here again when we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and decent value near hot spots”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Billy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 2 nights here. The inexpensive rooms (where we stayed) are old but have new updates (granite counters, etc.) The staff was very accommodating and the grounds well-kept. THe restaurants are fun and well-staffed. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most awesome hotel in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: jan6bowers
Reviews.Content: We recommend this hotel to anyone we know coming to San Diego. It has everything anyone could want....location, convenience to all attractions, beauty. Can't say enough good things about THE DANA.

Reviews.Title: “A truly beautiful and family friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjconger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed in. The views of the water from your room are breathtaking. The staff was wonderful and the grounds are stunning. If you are traveling with a family, this couldn't be a better choice. The location is perfect! Very close to the beach and attractions! The grassy areas to relax and play, the two great pools, and the views are just a few reasons why my family will for sure keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “The icing on the cake for our Mother/Daughter trip to visit USD!”
Reviews.Author: LorifromNewport
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot for my daughter and I when we came to look at the University of San Diego. The staff could not have been more helpful. The front desk clerks were wonderful. The waitstaff in the restaurants were cheerful and we looked forward to seeing our hostess every morning for breakfast. Continental breakfast was included in our package. The Firefly had excellent food. Decadent dessets! We used public transportation every day. The bus stop is right across the street. Very easy! We always felt safe, even when we were coming home at night. It looks like my daughter will be attending USD in the Fall. My family will definitely be staying at The Dana every time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkWing
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a resort, I suppose because they have two pools. However, I have stayed in larger rooms in Manhattan. The basic rooms are cramped, especially with two beds. On the positive side, the TVs are among the best I've ever found in a hotel--so good that we stayed in two nights to watch movies in the room. Located on the bay but not on the beach. Should you be going to Sea World, this would be a good location with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey89
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at The Dana for a few nights after he got home from a deployment. We were greeted with an excellent staff at the front who told us all about the hotel and where to eat. Our room was over looking the bay and was so pretty. I was very impressed the whole 4 days I was there. We ate at the two restaurants and both of them were good and we didn't have to wait long. I would recommend this hotel to everybody and would def come back for another vacation. We had so much fun! So many things to do. The pools are great and its so close to Mission Beach. Excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Sea World. Overall a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AmberVon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana when we went to Sea World because it is so close. There is a free shuttle from the hotel to Sea World but it's easily in walking distance. In fact, we walked back to the hotel after our day at Sea World. Our suite was spacious and nicely decorated. There was a small kitchen and the bathroom was huge and surprisingly posh. We loved the floor to ceiling windows in the living area that overlooked a large deck. The view of the bay from our room was nice. We didn't use the pools but we saw plenty of hotel guests taking advantage of them - it was chilly outside but the pools are heated! We had breakfast two times at the hotel restaurant and by all accounts the food was good with generous portions. My only complaint was the layout of the suite. It was awkward and backwards. The front door opened into the bedroom which was attached to the kitchen and bathroom. The 'living area' where my 11 year old son slept on the pull-out couch was in the back attached to the deck and was the only room that had a door for privacy. So if he had to get up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, he essentially came out into our room to get into the bathroom. This completely eliminated any privacy for the adults and ensured there was no romantic 'adult time' all weekend so to speak. Overall, a nice place to stay but don't expect privacy if you're travelling with friends or as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: djtilapia
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at The Dana for Valentine's Day "Staycation" because we're both from San Diego. Location is great for anyone looking to stay right by the water. Sea World is right down the street and Mission Beach is just a drive in the opposite direction. Our good buddy runs the kitchen at Firefly at the Dana. Great food. The view from our patio was the best thing, which overlooked the water and the boats. A big pool, with jacuzzi. We had no trouble with privacy, since we had the last suite on the top floor. No unwanted noise, so great place to relax. Suite was more than spacious, with a king size bed, and a separate sitting room which connects to a big patio. Located close to the 8 freeway, and not far from restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “nice location proffessional staff”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl35
Reviews.Content: got a great last minute deal for the Dana when we arrived we were pleased with the location . our room was well appointed clean and met our needs well. we will definately be back this summer . during our trip my 2 year old lost her shoe I called the hotel they took my information etc I thought it was a lost cause. then I got a phone call and they found it and were more than happy to ship it to me free of charge . now that is good business...

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Nelspark
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel and had the unfortunate experience of checking in on a Friday at 4:00 when a large conference was also checking in. Only three staff were on the front desk and I had to wait for 30 minutes to be checked in. The good thing was that once I got to the front desk, they apologized for the wait and provided free parking and upgraded me to a larger room with a great view of the harbour. The room itself was clean and spacious and even though there was a large conference occurring at the same time, it was quiet. I didn't hear a peep from any of the other rooms. Unfortunately the two times we wanted assistance at the front desk, they were woefully understaffed and it took at least 10 minutes to get any assistance. Once there was only one other person in the lobby, and we still couldn't find a staff member to help us. This was at 5:00 p.m. so you'd think it wouldn't be hard to locate staff in the lobby who would be free to assist. Overall, a clean, quiet room with friendly staff but either understaffed or not present at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, if a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: miggus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Dana as part of a business conference, and was quite happy with the experience. First the positives: the property is in a nice area, very close to Sea World and Mission Bay (although being in meetings all day I didn't get to experience either). The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the meal services, both in the restaurant and for the meeting, were a highlight of my stay. The bedding was decent and the bath area was fine. The 42" flat screen TV was larger than I would normally expect. The room had a small refrigerator and microwave, which I didn't use but which would have come in handy on a leisure visit. The meeting facility was convenient, except for the fact that there were no restrooms and we had to go over to the reception area on our breaks. The airport shuttle ($9 each way) helped us avoid renting a car, although they only run between 8 am and 8 pm. Whether the negatives are significant depends on your needs. The rooms are a bit cramped, though similar to other San Diego properties I've stayed at. There isn't really a workspace per se, just a small round table at the side of the bed. There aren't any usable power outlets near the nightstand, making charging a laptop or cell phone inconvenient. Although the rooms have been updated, they are clearly older and not very well noise-insulated. I could hear a baby crying from the room above each morning at 5 am, though coming from the East Coast I was already awake. You could also hear anyone walking by the room, along with doors shutting, cars starting, etc. It was hard to darken the room completely, as the shutters don't close completely. That being said, I've had much worse and wasn't too bothered. All in all, it's a very decent property given the location, and I would readily stay there again under the right circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Valentine's/Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Cass2713
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely love the Dana on Mission Bay! It is such a beautiful hotel located in such a beautiful place. I could wake up to that view everyday! My boyfriend and I have celebrated our one year and two year anniversaries there and there's no doubt that we will continue to do so! I recommend the hotel to all of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: GregAliceSprings
Reviews.Content: Very personal treatment, bent over backwards to assist in any way. If the person on the desk did not know, they found out! They asked when is the est ime to clean your room. The room attendants were very nice. The dinner restaurant was OUTSTANDING! The breakfast/lunch place was a bit slow, sometimes??? I also noticed they got a bit frustrated when other people joined you at your table.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back...”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutoftherain
Reviews.Content: I had to spend one night in San Diego before moving to a hotel inland. I chose the Dana because of other reviews and the location of the hotel. I really wish we had more than one night here. I was with my 13 year old daughter. We arrived later at night. Front desk was efficient and organized. As we were only there for one night, I didn't really care about the view. As it turned out, the room looked out onto the cove pool. NIce...although could probably be loud if there were lots of people in the pool. Room was nicely decorated, 2 queen beds...comfortable, smooth sheets and fluffy towels. There is a microwave, coffee maker and small fridge. Coffee packages were Wolfgang Puck brand. We decided to order room service for breakfast. Came to $20.00 (including tax, mandatory gratuity and service charge) but for cereal, fruit, orange juice, eggs, toast and hashbrowns I would say it is really not much more than one would pay at a decent restaurant (not talking Denny's or IHOP). We left the car at the hotel and took the shuttle to Seaworld. Stayed the day and then left. Staff at the front desk were very informative about directions. The setting is beautiful and the grounds nice. Sure there is a parking charge, but majority of the decent hotels in the area do charge. If you don't want to pay it, stay at a cheaper..yet no way near as nice hotel, in a different area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy camper!”
Reviews.Author: eastman427
Reviews.Content: Well a couple weeks ago, I decided to stay at the Dana for one night. I stayed and had a wonderful time the hotel is beautiful and was very happy with my first impression. That night I recieved a phone call from the hotel at 130 am telling me I've been booked in the wrong room but I can stay there on them. The next day I check my bank statements and I had already paid online through Expedia so my room and services were already paid for. I check my statemnts and over $150 was missing. I call the Dana and talk to the accountant and the people they booked me in their room all their charges were charged to my card, after leaving work early to find the solution, we figured it out. I was givin a free room on them. Two days later I go to get gas and my card declines, I check my bank statements on my phone and the $150 was not put on my card yet. So it took them 3 days to refund my money so I was given dinner at their resturant the firefly. Then I stayed this last weekend Sat-Sun. I got the same room [bayside] and had dinner on them. Dinner was wonderful and the service was great. I return to my room and get constant complaints of loud noise, jumping on the bed and banging the door. It was before 12am, and I don't consider walking in the room jumping on the bed. Also, hotel doors slam and I got complaints for my door. Then.. security of the Dana comes to my room at 2 in the morning saying I have these complaints and I have to leave the hotel. Over jumping on the bed??? And my slamming door. YES, the security harrassed me to leave and told me I better sleep in my car and he was calling law enforcement. I was excited to talk to a policemen but that never happened so around 3 I packed my things and left. The next day I get charged over $200 for the people who complaineds' room. I think this is poposterious. Never did I sign consent to pay for someone elses room. They left because they had felt threatened by my spouce. Does anyone think this is as ridiculous and I do. Seriously!?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Diego, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: hbowler54
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Dana on Mission Bay a couple times a year and always have the best experience. The location is gorgeous and the rooms are always clean and ready to accomodate. We have 2 young children and they absolutely love this hotel. The pools are beautiful and one even has a beach with sandtoys for the kids to play. We wouldn't even consider staying elsewhere! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: wildflowergal1
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a clean hotel with Wi-Fi, Pay per View, a Pool, and Jaquzzi. The grounds are nice with two restaurants on site. The surrounding area is beautiful looking right out on a marina. You are within a 10 minute walk to the ocean. Also, there is a large park within walking distance. This area is only an 8 minute drive to Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo which is why we chose it in the first place. I was not that impressed with the hotel itself but I loved the location. If you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room, I would recommend this for travelors and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: CoffsFamily
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2-deck suite and were pleasantly surprised by the great view of the Bay and wonderful spa and swimming pool. It's a pity that our stay was not as good as first impressions. #1, the parking is inadequate - there hardly seems enough spaces for half the rooms. Best advice is to get in early and leave your car there or you'll have to walk a mile. #2, the rooms are not dark enough - lights all around make you feel like you're a battery hen and the trendy looking wooden blinds are useless and impossible to keep closed. #3, the staff are rude and the service is hopeless - for example we put one of our toddlers down for a sleep at 10am and asked if the room could be made up when we went out at 1pm. "No problem sir" was the front desk response but when we returned at 6pm nothing had been done. I phoned the front desk who said they'd have it seen to straight away. We went for a swim for 1 hour and when we came back all that had happened was the towels had been replaced. I could go on but that was just a taste and no apology offered. #4, the room service is expensive and then they slug you with a delivery fee and compulsory gratuity, despite the bad service. All up, it's a nice location, good pool, looks great on the internet but it's what you can't see that means we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Diego--Wild Party next door to our room”
Reviews.Author: grahamphoto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but we had the misfortune of a wild party with about ten people in nearby room that kept us up most of the night. Called front desk at 2 a.m., 2:15, 2:30, 2:45 and 3, but they chose not to deal with it. The easy way: knock on the room door, ask to see the registered guest, and then demand that the rest of the crowd leave. That didn't happen. In fact, the party was still going on the next morning--with cigarette smokers in the room and on the balcony--in this non-smoking area. The hotel was well aware of what was going on, and for whatever reason, decided not to handle it. The hotel has since offered us two free nights to return--what we haven't heard is a change in policy. What happens the next time there's a post-midnight party in the next door room? The good: great location, beautiful views, terrific pool, Hawaii like layout. The bad: $9.99 a night for wireless Internet and above issue with partyers.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in a wonderful setting.”
Reviews.Author: loonlvr
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful surprise to find the Dana on Mission Bay with rooms starting at $84.00. We chose a more expensive room with a view of the Marina but next time I'll choose one of the courtyard rooms with a patio looking onto the pool. The grounds are beautiful with volleyball nets, two swimming pools and hot tub. The hotel is on a path that runs along the Bay and the day we were there there were runners, walkers, bicyclists, rowers, volleyball players and folks just enjoying the great weather. We ate in both the upscale Firefly restaurant. It was excellent. The other restaurant is a cafe with a wide choice of moderately priced items. There is a bike and boat rental office on site. The daily parking fee was $18 as opposed to the $25.00 charged by the more-expensive Hilton Hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: dis3fam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a result of a Priceline bid. We got the room for $65 a night which seemed like a great rate considering how much it normally costs to reserve a room at this hotel. First off I have to say the night staff is horrible!!! absolutely horrible. I called 5 times to get a crib delivered!!! When it finally was delivered we were out at dinner and I come back to the room and see the most beat up, stained Pack n Play I've ever seen! So I open it up in disgust to see the condition of the inside and there are pincher bugs crawling around in it! I immediately called the front desk to have someone pick it up and deliver another one. I told him about the bugs and he didn't even apologize. It took over an hour to get the crib, meanwhile by 2 year is exhausted and needs to go to bed and I have no crib!! The next pack n play delivered was in better shape but still stained in spots, so I wiped it down with antibacterial wipes and used by crib sheets i brought from home. We also traveled with my parents and my brothers family. The garbage in their rooms didn't get emptied each day or hotel products refilled. I had no kleenex refills or soap. I had to call down to the front desk again the next night to have some delivered. I heard the same front desk agent as the prior night exhale a sigh in disgust when I asked him for the soap and kleenex. The carpet is extremely dirty and not vacuumed each day. The room is cramped and small. There is no closet only a small wardrobe in the corner. The cable came in fuzzy, might as well not have even had a TV in the room. The bed was uncomfortable and the sheets were just sad. I wasn't even warm at night they were so thin. The only thing I was glad about was that it was only $65 a night and that I hadn't made full rack rate for the room. I wanted to go back to the Hojo in Anaheim that we had just come from during our Disneyland trip because it was sooooooooo much nicer than this place. The location is probably the only thing going for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: tate41
Reviews.Content: From cleanliness to extremely courteous and friendly staff, the Dana on Mission Bay, San Diego is a great place to stay. I would highly recommend this place on your next visit to San Diego. We booked our room a number of months in advance after researching numerous hotels in the area and were not disappointed with our choice. The staff at the front desk were always helpful and courteous. The wait staff and manager at the Blue Pearl restaurant were always friendly, efficient and courteous. The food was also excellent and a generous portion for the price! I can remember the manager's name but she was always a ray of sunshine in the morning with a delightful "goood morning" as we walked in the front door for breakfast. The room was always clean and very welcoming. On one instance the handle of the toilet broke. We called the front desk and within 10 minutes the maintenance man was there fixing it. It was only in the 60's when we were there so we didn't use the pool all that much despite it being heated to 85 degrees. We got more use out of the hot tubs which accommodated at least 10 people easily (not that there were 10 people in the tub). The grounds around the hotel were lush and had a Hawaiian feel to them. Gorgeous views out to Mission Bay and beyond. And only a 10 minute walk to Sea World or a 5 minute complimentary shuttle ride from the hotel. All in all a great hotel to stay at for the price and would not hesitate to book another stay there should we visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is a perfect choice for a San Diego visit”
Reviews.Author: MarionJones
Reviews.Content: We always stay in the premium deluxe bay View room. They are on the top floor with a marvelous view of mission bay. The Pool and Spa is quiet and relaxing. The room is clean, spacious and comfortable. Within 7 miles of most attractions, parks, harbor. We love it and will be back anytime we come to SanDiego!

Reviews.Title: “Mission Bay Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ehayinaz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in Mission Beach with easy quick access to everything you'd want to do inSan Diego without paying high prices stay at the Dana! The rooms are clean, roomy and comfortable and the staff really acts like they want you to have a great time. We've stayed in the finest hotels in and out of the country, but when we come to Mission Bay we stay at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is like a refuge for us from the hustle and bustle of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: peach622
Reviews.Content: Our son is a student at USD so we visit San Diego freqently and we always look forward to spending some relaxing "down time " at The Dana. Convenient location with shuttle service and flexible check-in times are appreciated. Billing questions are handled . promptly and to the guests' satisfaction. We received a free upgrade on our last visit for being return guests. Rates were more than reasonable and I really liked their separate lobby computer station for printing boarding passes and web check-in for airline travel. I also enjoy the daily USA Today newspapers provided in the lobby, where we are always greeted by courteous and helpful front desk personnel. In short, we would never stay anywhere else when visiting San Diegoother than The Dana on Mission Bay. Carrie and Jim Bennett. Bennett Orchards. Frankford, Delaware

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is "NIRVANA"”
Reviews.Author: Opulence_13
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Dana Inn for fourteen years. My children all learned to play tennis on the courts that have made way for a larger parking lot. There was always so much activity from renting a scooter, bicycle, or jet ski.,To having a fancy non-alcoholic beverage by the pool!! Even though they now have added more "condo "like facilities, I still enjoy staying in the "older" sections as it has such wonderful memories for me!! The BleuPearl (which use to be the Country Kitchen) is still readily accessible and reasonable in price. I never minded having my children "charge" to the room because the price of a burger and fries was equivalent to McDonalds) Time has moved us on....I still enjoy going there aon a weekend to relax....or bringing my new grandcildren so they can now enjoy what their parents did....it is our "family Tradition" They now cater even more to families with their movies at night while enjoying a swim!! Reasonably priced, beauttiful surrounds and grounds, and service that is Bar-none!!! Patricia Smith Phoenix Arizona 85032

Reviews.Title: “The Dana on Mission Bay is worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: AskDrMac
Reviews.Content: I brought a national leadership program (Leading From Within) to The Dana and could not have been more satisfied. The conference and catering staff were exceptional to work with and very helpful. The views of the bay, the boats, the palm trees, and the pool outside our conference room put my clients in a relaxed state of mind...perfect for the leadership work we did together. On top of the scenic location, the ocean is a short 20-minute walk from the grounds. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ajpunzal
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good food, beautiful view of the water. Overall wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “The best place hotel I've been too”
Reviews.Author: j0jean619
Reviews.Content: This is the best place I've stayed at...I have my wedding reception here and the staff is wonderful perfcet in a sense. Our reception was catered by the Fire Fly resturant and the food is A+. My Wife and I had a suite and the suite had everything I could think of, large bed perfect flat screen TV kitchen large bathroom and a living room as well. We ordered room service and the food delicious and the service was even better. The staff is incredible and has great customer service I recommend this place to everyone is something to experience! I recommend staying at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY AT THE DANA!”
Reviews.Author: anabelle2
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay!. I loved this place so much. I even told my friends and they booked their stay and thanked me with dinner! (maybe Im in the wrong profession) From the first minutes of our arrival, we felt very welcomed.A pretty and friendly blond named Rachel greeted us and gave us all the information we needed. We were starving so she suggested we eat at the" Blue Pearl " and it was delicious and convienient. Our room had a gorgeous view of the bay and the beds were very comfortable. The room was spotless and filled with all the toiletries we needed. My husband uses our hot tub daily so he was happy to not break that habit and enjoy the hot tub at the hotel. We will be back and we will tell everyone who wants to visit San Diego. Thank you for the hospitality

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TIMES ON MISSION BAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie60958
Reviews.Content: My family and I got away with the kids for a week long stay in San Diego. We choose The Dana on Mission Bay since a co-worker and friend told me that I wouldn't be disappointed. I AM SO GLAD I LISTENED TO HER! (She sometimes exaggerates) This time she was right on! We were warmly welcomed by Ms Averella at the front desk who told us everything to expect and places to go and where to eat etc...she had to deal with my whining kid while I plowed her with questions (she gave him a lollipop). She was soooo nice and so was the whole staff. I think I want to move to California! Oh The room was gorgeous, clean and had everything we wanted.. We all slept like babies. We liked the hot tub and pool too.

Reviews.Title: “A total rip off”
Reviews.Author: afursten
