Reviews.Content: I had one night to spend on my own in San Diego and decided to pay for more than just a motel in order to enjoy a nice view and not have to worry about parking, internet, or breakfast. The internet was crucial to me since I needed to work a little bit too. So I did not take the standard room but paid more (USD 139) to get the "Marina view". It turns out that all rooms are located in motel-like buildings, 2 floors high. I was lucky to get a room in the second floor, so that I could say that there was something of a view, however if you are staying inside the room and don't want everyone to look into it you have to close the blinds and there goes your view! And of course you hear every step of any person which walks not even close to your room because of the wooden deck,. The room had nothing significant more than a regular motel 6 room, not even a desk, was poorly insulated (both temperature and noise wise). The advertised "complimentary" internet access actually costs USD 9.99 per 24 hours, parking a ridiculous USD 18 to park in front of your motel section (you have no choice). Furthermore, for the "complimentary" breakfast for which you already pay USD 7 when you book online, you actually just get a USD 10 voucher which does not even cover the cheapest breakfast item on the list of the restaurant you can go to. Conclusion: a total rip off, by no means worth the almost USD 200 it ended up costing, they will not see me again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTheWanderer
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay was a very good choice for us. Our room had a super view of the bay and was comfortable, if not exactly distinctive from most other hotel rooms. It was well maintained and the reception staff were helpful. The pool was very nice - although its opening hours (10am onwards) are clearly not designed for the business traveller or busy sightseeing tourist! As others have mentioned, SeaWorld is just a 15 min walk away (most of that time being spent wandering through SeaWorld grounds). When you're soaked from the rides or Shamu's mischievous splashing, having a base nearby in which to change is a reassuring thought! Travel into San Diego is fine. The 28 & 29 buses run regularly from Old Town. A taxi from the Amtrak station costs around $22-25. The shuttle van can take you to the airport. A special word finally for the Firefly restaurant. We ate there twice and actually found it the best place we ate at on our 12 day holiday. Menu choice was not huge, but food was excellent and service top notch. I also really liked their "Take Flight" deal, which allows you to sample small glasses of a selection of 3 California wines or local beers.

Reviews.Title: “Purfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: cocoabeachshark
Reviews.Content: We ended up here by chance on Christmas Eve. We had booked at the Bahia, next door. Upon our arrival we found out that our room was occupied. We had booked a aprticula room, because we have stayed in the same room many time. We were told we could stay in another, older room. So, we cancelled the reservation, and went here. They had room for us on Christmas Eve, on the spot! It was much nicer than next door and newer. Awsome! we had a view of the bay, and the bathrooms were nice and upgraded Even the soap and lotion was eco friendly. Flat screen TV, and small kitchenette with small fridge, which is a god sent with a 2 year old. 5 minutes from Seaworld. The staff was very nice.We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, very pleasant stay, and convenient, loved the electronic concierge!”
Reviews.Author: ljulian12
Reviews.Content: Everything you want to do is right there located in close proximity to the hotel. Sea World is across the street and the hotel provides a shuttle service for drop off and pick-up to the park which was extremely convenient! Loved the room, the view was amazing and the service of the staff was great as well. In the lobby there is a television/computer that is an electronic concierge and provides a lot of helpful ideas for what to do at the hotel and the surrounding areas. Very enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanhBaxter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference in December 2010. Had a bay-side room which was well-maintained, large and comfortable with 2 queen-sized beds. Both Firefly and Blue Pearl restaurants are very good and represent good value. Close proximity of hotel to SeaWorld is also a major advantage (a 10 min walk with just one pedestrian crossing to navigate). Finally, pool and hot tub were also very pleasant. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPennyB
Reviews.Content: The Dana on MIssion Bay is a top notch hotel. Our room was clean, amazingly comfortable and the entire staff that we came into contact with were very knowledgeable and friendly! It's a 15 minute walk to Sea World, or you can take the shuttle! There are two pools, and it is very kid friendly. There are boats available to rent, and two restaurants on site. I look forward to staying here during my next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “I never wanted to leave.”
Reviews.Author: zombiemaegan
Reviews.Content: I had such a great time in San Diego and The Dana played a huge part in making my trip so great. The staff was very friendly, the room was very clean, the pools were gorgeous, the food was great.. everything was wonderful. The view was phenomenal and there was so many nice places to walk around, especially with the marina right there. I also enjoyed being able to rent bikes and paddle boats.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana was rad...”
Reviews.Author: kerryberry187
Reviews.Content: The Dana was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. The room and view was gorgeous, the pool was warm and the bed was more comfortable than my own. I didn't want to leave and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego...

Reviews.Title: “Outdoor jacuzzi :)”
Reviews.Author: JanBotto
Reviews.Content: -Nice rooms with noisy a/c -Very nice outdoor jacuzzi with really hot water -parking in-front out of room -coin washing machine

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: CraigB1970
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay has the potential to be a great place to stay - great location (close to SeaWorld, not far from the ocean and Down Town), nice views, great outdoor spa. It just lacks in a few key areas to be great - things like us booking a king bed, only to arrive and find that there weren't any king beds available, so we'd have to take a queen bed. Not a huge drama, but if you book a king bed, you should get a king bed. We got to the room only to find that the safe didn't work, and the fridge didn't work. Plus the bathroom lights were faulty, and needed replacing. And to top it off, the shower played up during our stay - it was one of those shower/baths, and the nozzle you pushed to make it go from bath to shower died after day 1, and we had to play around with it to get it to work for the final 2 days. We loved the outdoor spa - our room was right near it, so we had a short trip. The spa was nice and warm, plenty of room. Great view of the marina. The front desk staff were courteous, friendly, and helpful, and the free shuttle to SeaWorld was good also (tho' SeaWorld is very close). The Dana is a nice hotel, but needs to provide more for the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: 2000eyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in early November 2010. Got the hotel thru Priceline which said it was a 3.5 star hotel. When I checked in, the front desk person was very pleasant and did not make a big deal out of the fact that I got my room at a cheap rate. I asked if there is a renovated section of the hotel and there is, but it would cost $50 a night upgrade. We decided to just keep our room. Parking is $18 a day with no where else to park. Our room was on the second floor of a motel-style building (outdoor hallways which my wife did not like). The room was small. Two queen beds but could not walk along the side nearest the window. The decor was fine. There was a larger mini-fridge (I mean bigger than the little usual square dorm fridge) and a microwave. Nice large flat-screen TV maybe 46" or larger. Bathroom was clean. Soft matresses which were not comfortable to me but as we were leaving a huge Serta semi was pulling into the parking lot! The room was obviously renovated at some point but the work looked a bit unprofessional. I didn't mind it too much but I know some reviewers would not like it and share photos of bad tile grout or paint jobs. Overall, we had a decent stay. The only problem I had was that it doesn't seem like a 3.5 upscale hotel. The newer side, however, is probably much nicer and maybe deserves the 3.5 star rating. The location was central to many S.D. attractions. Probably not more than a 10-15 min drive to the airport, Balboa Park, Gaslamp, La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodit_jodit_jodit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana in the new part. It was a wonderful hotel room. Had a seperate bedroom and a great view. Everything was perfect for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...perfect for families :)”
Reviews.Author: pedslvn75
Reviews.Content: My family(me,my husband & our 22 month old son) stayed at The Dana in August 2010 for 2 nights in a suite to celebrate my birthday. We loved the location & the view was beautiful. We had such a great view of the Sea World fireworks & the bay. The suite was the perfect size & my son loved the huge balcony...being able to see all the birds & boats! We loved having a small kitchen & a separate room for my son to sleep in. We did have a few issues during our stay...room service issues & hot water issues. These issues were handled very efficiently by the guest relations manager, Jennifer. I can honestly say that this is a hotel that values their customers & wants them to have a great experience...The Dana was very willing to make the situation right. The Dana will be our place to stay in San Diego now...all because of the wonderful guest service we received! Highly recommend :) If you are going to Sea World the location can't be beat, the room are spacious & clean and the pool area is really nice too! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Overall”
Reviews.Author: deniseprecious
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in 2 rooms. The purpose of the trip was to see Marine Boot Camp graduation. A free shuttle is provided for that and the driver was excellent. The lobby is upscale and impressive. The rooms themselves are older but nice. I paid $65 a night for each room with my Entertainment Book discount. I booked directly through the Entertainment website. I thought the price was excellent for a 3 1/2 star hotel. I looked around at other places like La Quinta and HolidayInn, but felt this was the best deal. We had a simple problem with the tv. When we called the front desk, there were there to fix it in 3 minutes. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The ayes have it!”
Reviews.Author: KYColonelLoves2Go
Reviews.Content: We really debated staying here as the reviews were so mixed. But decided to try. It was marvelous. We were in bld. 2000 with a balcony overlooking the bay. This appeared to be a newer section to the hotel. The room was spacious & comfortable. Staff were friendly & helpful. Breakfast in the restaurant was outstanding! Large portions of fresh food were promptly served. There is a nice area around the pool to sit & enjoy the evening. The location was super as it is close to many attractions. The hotel provides shuttle service to many sites & the trolley stops by. The grounds were very well kept & had lush foilage. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two hotels in one. Rennovated Rooms ok. Old Rooms Need TLC.”
Reviews.Author: Orangemen
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very close to sea world. We stayed on the rennovated side and feel that we paid way too much for the room. If you can get the rennovated room for a low rate, then it would be good for families with kids. The older side of the hotel seems more like a motel and I would not stay there. Restaurant was very expensive and portions small. I would stay here again only if I was able to get a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Mass thinks poorly of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hazzzexplorer
Reviews.Content: reserved a king size bed, was given two full size beds instead. Rooms look like a converted Econo Lodge. Bathrooms small, toilet is like sitting on the floor. Loud, you can hear the neighbors talking in normal voices. Air planes are right over head. Poor security, widows didn't lock the first two nights. Had to pay for WIFI, most places offer for free.$18.00 a day for parking. Ratty looking carpeting. Alarm clock woke us up in the middle of the night. Hotel staff walked in on daughter-inlaw when she was getting dressed. No "Do Not Disturb" signs. I expected better for the prices they charge, and the star rating the hotel is given.

Reviews.Title: “nice views”
Reviews.Author: t-m-c-m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a king Premium Bay View room. Our room was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the bay, good views and being able to sit on the balcony was very relaxing - nice to watch the sunset. The room was modern, very clean and of a good size with asofa bed, fridge/microwave and sink area. The bathroom was also fairly big. Internet connection was very good - (we wern't going to bother with it, as we thought there was a charge for it...but it was free) Downside was that I do think the $18 a night car parking fee was way too much!

Reviews.Title: “Here's what to ask for...”
Reviews.Author: carolgustie
Reviews.Content: We came to the Dana two days ago and are happy with the property. I found it on Travel Zoo for a great rate. When I called The Dana with some questions they said they would waive the the parking fee and the internet charges. It might have been because I booked with a Travel Zoo rate. There are two buildings on the property - ask for the newer building. We love it! We have a great view of the water with a private balcony. The room is equipped with a fridge,microwave and coffee maker and is quite spacious. We were able to heat up our leftovers for a snack. The heated pool and hot tub are great. It seems that most of the unhappy comments are with people who are in the older building.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, and not great”
Reviews.Author: hbundy4
Reviews.Content: Really still 1970s. Noisy, lights from spotlights came through windows, not particularly clean. Charged for internet and lots for parking... unacceptable nickel-and-diming for a supposedly 3.5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: RITraveler50
Reviews.Content: I took the advice of most of the reviews and spent more for a spa suite. The room was large enough (only two of us) with a deck overlooking the bay and the bed was very comfortable. The heated pool was incredible with a 2-feet area for smaller children. The location is a short hop to Old Town and Coronado and it is a stone's throw to Mission Beach. The only drawback was the business center was only 1 computer so it was difficult to print boarding passes because of limited availability. Would definitely stay here again and do advise the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad deal all around, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Zimbru
Reviews.Content: This is a glorified sideroad motel with dirty looking, outdated rooms, with an awkward location. Kids enjoyed the pool but but you have to drive for everything else and the parking is a ridiculous $18 / night. This hotel ( motel ) warrants about 1 star. We will not go back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Pyrate2
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Dana on Mission Bay. The rooms are nice and the bay is only a few steps away. The atmosphere here is peaceful and romantic. We especially love the heated pools. It's a great way to relax after a day at Sea World. There is even a bus stop near the hotel that will take you to Sea World if you don't feel like driving. There are two restaurants on the premises and we tried the Blue Pearl which is more casual dining. I recommend staying away from this restaurant. The food was horrible. Save your money and go elsewhere to eat. We haven't tried the more upscale restaurant(Firefly), but its located near one of the pools. It can feel a bit strange if you are swimming and you can see people eating nearby. Overall, our family loves this hotel and we would definitely come back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, maybe worth it to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: traveller12020
Reviews.Content: We thought the Dana was very nice. The lobby and pool area looked new and modern, staff was very friendly and helpful. The actual room we stayed in was ok. It was more like a motel where the doors to the rooms were on the outside of the building (we weren't expecting that). There is a newer building we could have stayed in...for an extra charge. That one looked a lot nicer with balconies overlooking the bay. Would probably pay the extra $ for one of those rooms if we were to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Dana on Mission Bay in San Diego, Ca.”
Reviews.Author: Fenger57
Reviews.Content: We feel that The Dana is one of the best kept secrets on Mission Bay. My husband and I have been annual guests for the past 30 plus years. Each year we have seen an expansion, improvement or both. It has been fun to watch them grow and we're excited to see what's in the future. They offer room rates to fit everyone's budget and all of the rooms we stayed in were immaculate and well maintained. We love it there. As for tips-Visit the little bait house on the marina for a fresh sandwich or go across the street to a little brown seafood restaurant. Ask where the Wave House is located (close by). It's located by the beach and has excellent breakfasts at reasonable prices. (Mission Beach is a 2 minute drive away)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: carmen33008
Reviews.Content: A beautiful location with two pools and a great walking trail. We stayed in the older half of the hotel, but the room was clean and cool. Excellent breakfast at the Blue Pearl.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel with nice surroundings”
Reviews.Author: GingerKern_Ca
Reviews.Content: Our first time at the Dana. It's an older hotel but well kept. The rooms are small, so it would be harder for a large family or group to stay in, but they are fine for a couple. The off-season rate is good. We didn't like the wall air/heater as it was noisy so couldn't sleep well with it on. The people at the Dana were all very nice and helpful. The shuttle to Sea World is excellent. I know it's the thing to do now to charge parking but this hotel is so spread out, I think they could drop that. The room was quiet! Overall, a good experience. Be sure to eat at the restaurant adjacent to the hotel (Blue Pearl)

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Dana! Will be returning again and again :)”
Reviews.Author: Noemi2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, updated, elegant, has all the bells and whistles! Super clean, tastefully decorated, great area and the views...are breathtaking. This was our first time booking a room at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We found out that we had been upgaded to a suite! The suite was wonderful and roomy, my kids were all smiles, we got a great night sleep and had coffee the following morning in the balcony....we loved the suite so much that we asked if it was available for another night (it wasn't, but we tried). Our family will never book another hotel when in the San Diego area :) recommend this hotel, the staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Tafirula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Dana from September 18th thru the 21st. I'd already checked pictures here in TripAdvisor, and knew before hand the parking fee ($18 usd per day, but they only charge 2 days), so no surprises for us. Check-in was excellent, and the upgraded us to a bay-room in the new remodelated area. I did send an email asking to be place there, and were lucky enough to get it! The room was very spacious for a family of four, it had a microwave, a small fridge in a kitchenette that we didn't use but to wash our mugs. It had a balcony with a partial view of the bay (we had to be in the balcony to see the bay). We could hear the seagulls very early in the morning!! I hardly hear noise even thought we were almost near the stairs (we were on a 2nd room). The bathroom was big and very nice, I like it even better than the bathroom at the Grand Californian in Anaheim. Lots of towels, bathrobes for the adults and pool towels as well. Amenities very nice, I usually don't like to use shampoos in the hotel, but these ones had a great smell and leave my hair so nice that I was glad to use them. Overall, we loved the room, great value indeed. What we didn't like was the carpet outside, it was old and stained in some places, it didn't match up with the rooms at all, I suppose they will change that as well. We did stroll to the other area of the hotel, where the older rooms are, and from the outside we liked them better than our area, it had a tropical feeling to it and the pool seemed nice enought. We used the shuttle to Sea World, it arrive promptly, but when waiting for it at our return, never came and we have to take a cab, which we regret when we noticed how near we where from the hotel, and after the treatment of the cabby who was very mad to take us so near. The pool are is nice, right in front of the Bay and The Firefly, We needed our key to enter, which was a good thing. Hot tub was great too after a long day at SeaWorld. Blue Pearl was closed the night we wanted to dine there, so we went to the Firefly, using our restaurant.com certificate. We liked the place and the food was good, I think is nice to dine there if you are staying at the hotel. Overall, a great place to stay in San Diego. We did have a car so the distance for us was no problem at all, so easy to drive in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “$18 PARKING PER NIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: agumonster
Reviews.Content: From the outside, Dana on Mission Bay looks beautiful. It is by the seaside, near Seaworld, and even the front desk looks inviting. On the inside, the rooms are small and no different than a room of a 3 star motel. We had something stolen from our room, but we couldn't prove it, so we weren't able to do anything about it. Overall, we were very disappointed with this place, because we read the reviews and expected more. The $18/night parking fee is a complete rip-off and if you add that onto your nightly rate, I know you can find a much better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our family enjoy our stay very much and...”
Reviews.Author: melbobe
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoy our stay very much and staff was very accomodating and friendly! Breakfast was delicious and afforadable at the Blue Pearl! Pool was great and the location was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Views”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoast5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 really enjoyed this hotel, we had a corner suite which gave us magnificent views of the bay & also the swimming pool. The bathroom was dimly lit with no ventilation - the toilet was not separate from the vanity & shower which proved to be a nightmare when we were all trying to get ready to go out - probably not an issue for most guests but we have three teenage daughters so you can imagine the elbowing & hissy fits that took place in a steamy dim lit bathroom - lol. Apart from that, we give the Firefly & Blue Pearl Restaurant the thumbs up! The staff were extremely friendly & attentive & the food was great. The Dana is located in close proximity to SeaWorld - we took the shuttle to get there but could have walked it easy. Families with younger children & the elderly would definitely benefit from the shuttle. A special thank you to Deepak - you were so helpful & accommodating when I made the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more”
Reviews.Author: ACTTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Loved our room and the beautiul views from our balcony. The staff were great, friendly and so helpful. Theres a cute little store that sells anything you may have forgotten and the staff in there are really friendly as well. Loved the Firefly restaurant so nice to sit and have a cocktail overlooking the marina and the food was excellent. Used the spa and it watched the fireworks from Sea world.The gardens are really pretty . We will be back. Loved the Hop on Hop off Buses which pick up from the Dana, loads of fun and lots of happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: fuzzeee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful & the view breathtaking. The staff was so friendly & accommedating. The next trip we make to San Diego, this will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelingagent_9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort, beautiful, clean rooms with amenities and good hair dryer. Wonderful and professionnal staff. Good food and good service at the Firefly. Pool temperature just perfect. I am a travel agent and I rate this hotel a 4 1/2*. The only reason that I don't rate this hotel a 5* is because parking is not included in the price. I am a travel agent and I would recommend this hotel to my customers. I do think that a car is needed though. By the way, parking is free at Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sa10
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived everything was perfect. Check in and the front desk folks warm and friendly. Directions to the room and the security gate to the parking that helped to insure your privacy. The beautiful green grass and plam trees in front of each building. The room was perfect with the views that we expected. The food and service at the Firefly and Blue Pearl were excellent. The Dana met all our expectations and then some. I can not wait to go back and spend a long weekend. We were here for Labor Day and a trip to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service and more.”
Reviews.Author: LovePalmBayClub
Reviews.Content: We came in for a family wedding. The recption also took place at this hotel. The location couldn't have been better, right on the Bay and very accessible to travel. The rooms are well appointed with above grade amenities and views. We particularly liked the staff who couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Dana”
Reviews.Author: lavu29
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Dana so much last year that we decided to return again this Labor Day Weekend. The bay view from our room's patio is the perfect place to relax and watch all the activities happening in the bay. The staff is very attentive to ensure your stay is pleasurable from the moment you check in. We had a barbecue picnic in the park just a few steps away from our room, it was so easy to transport everything we needed for a sunset picnic . Fun times! We hope to return again next year. The guest relations & reservations department are very attentive to their guests requests & needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: jenasuu
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Dana. It was a cozy retreat for 7 days while visiting family and friends in San Diego. Our room was at the tropical pool. Coffee on the patio or drinks at the pool was wonderful. Breakfast at the on-site restraunt, the Blue Pearl was delicious. We were able to see a wonderful closing fireworks show from Sea World if we were strolling the bayfront in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana at Mission Bay provides an atmosphere that allows my husband and me to relax in comfort.”
Reviews.Author: EllaBostonMA
Reviews.Content: take the time to walk around the grounds and look at the bay enjoy the pool and hot tub visit shopping at Fashion Valley Mall and Westfield Plaza explore Mission Beacjh and Pacific Beach trying local restaurants if in the mood for city experience, head downtown to Seaport Village, Balnoa Park, Little Italy

Reviews.Title: “perhaps not the best place to take children”
Reviews.Author: ldmaster
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in San Diego to go to Marine World and the San Diego Zoo. While the Dana is within walking distance of Marine World, there is little to no access to any beach, for that you need to cross the causeway and there you will find great beaches. The Dana is, or appears to be, a multi-use hotel resort. Attached to it is a marina with private docks, and apparently the members of the marina have full access to the pool - because this is where I stopped a violent attack by a drunken marina slip owner on a female guest. The man had obtained his alcohol from the poolside bar at The Dana, and was quite intoxicated when he was using loud profanity around the woman's children. When she confronted him on the issue, it turned ugly and he punched her in the face before I could intervene. The man had been warned about his behavior by hotel staff, but the staff members left the area after doing so. I told the man to leave, and he decided to run away when he believed the police had been called after he punched the female guest. It was then that I realized that the hotel had NO security on until 9pm and the police are understaffed, it took six hours for a police officer to respond to take the report. Of course by then the man was unidentifiable. The hotel was reluctant to admit to me that marina slip owners had the right to use the bar and pool. I would not recommend that a family use the main pool because of the poolside bar service and the access granted by drunken locals with little/no supervision by staff. The Dana has an arrangement with a restaurant that is adjacent to the hotel, and the food was acceptable but nothing to rave about. The rooms in the area we stayed were dated and somewhat cramped, there are three buildings that are newer and widely separated from the main hotel, these suites are more expensive, but it would be worth it to stay at those instead as they also have private balcony's. The rooms in my area were adjacent to a major road and the noise level was quite high, although I think that was mostly due to directly facing the roadway, not all rooms face that direction. The air conditioning barely kept up with the heat and internal humidity. There were very very few restaurants within walking distance, and NO beach. The hotel did give me a 20 percent discount for the assault having occurred. What dismayed me the most was the admission by the police officer who eventually showed up that San Diego had lost a sizeable chunk of it's veteran police force to retirement issues, forcing them to put new officers on the street who had not passed their field training. I'm a police officer and this alarmed me to the extent that I do not think I would vacation in the San Diego area again, if you get attacked, there are just no officers who are available to respond to an emergency. With the alcohol and party atmosphere that you usually associate with vacation spots like these, I'm used to a hotel having private security to keep their guests safe. I guess there's a reason they are slightly cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “One of our most positive experiences in ages!”
Reviews.Author: SamLucky
Reviews.Content: It is so very difficult to pick a hotel across the country without knowing anything but what you read. But this time, we got it right! My teenage daughter and I spent four days at The Dana in August and we enjoyed every minute of our stay -- really wished it could have been longer. I had to go to San Diego on business and decided to take some extra days before my work and just enjoy ourselves. What a great experience. From the moment we arrived - the front desk staff went above and beyond making sure we were settled in and knew how to get everywhere we wanted to go. Just minutes after arriving in our room, we got a follow up call from the manager to ensure that everything was ok - it was so much more. To a person, everyone was more than helpful. The room was fantastic, the view was great, the weather cooperated and we are already working on a plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a tropical island!”
Reviews.Author: EdieVH
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to San Diego to go to Sea World and decided to stay at The Dana on a friend's recommendation. We were not disappointed. We enjoyed the hotel, it had a very lush and tropical feel to it. Our room was on the ground level facing the bay. Our patio opened up to the Mission Bay park, which our kids loved. We were able to sit on the patio and watch them play by the rocks in the bay. Our kids are a bit older and may not be the best for little ones that need constant supervision. We wish we could have stayed longer and enjoyed the park and amenities=( Maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Book into a newer room”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 children (12,11) spent 4 nights at the Dana in mid July 2010. We had booked one of the newer Waterfront rooms and this was absolutely fine. It was slightly bigger than we expected and was pretty well equipped - it even had a microwave which we weren't expecting. As we walked through the grounds of the hotel we could see into other rooms that were being serviced by housekeeping and they did appear to be pretty dark and dingy so it is definitely worth getting into the new block if you can. Overall the hotel has a feel of a large motel - absolutely fine for us but if you are looking for a romantic getaway, this hotel isn't for you particularly not in July. The hotel pools were small and crowded so we didn't use them. They also charge for parking - $16 / night but only for 2 nights so if you're staying for longer, the other nights are free. The hotel is well placed to use as a base to explore San Diego. They run a shuttle to Seaworld which is very close by. We walked back from Seaworld because we wanted to leave at a non shuttle time and it only took 15-20 minutes. Thy told us at checkin that our room rate included a credit towards breakfast which was great (and a surprise) so we ate at the Blue Pearl restaurant every morning. The food here was good and it really set us up for the day. We just signed the breakfast to our room and this was deducted at checkout - except for any gratuity which we'd added. I had expected a beach at the hotel but this was only a short 5 minute drive away although in high summer, it was a total nightmare trying to park anywhere close to the beach. All in all, the Dana is fine though if I were ever to return to San Diego, I would probably look elsewhere as it really had nothing that would want me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but sorely in need of better maintenance and customer service...”
Reviews.Author: Moxiefe1
Reviews.Content: The Dana has a beautiful location and its proximity to Sea World is terrific. The grounds are very nice. Our room had a great view and was large (a suite in the newer building). However, the hotel is in need of significant attention to routine maintenance. Some of the issues are more or less minor (although annoying at this price point--e.g. dead batteries in remote, broken shower fixture, finicky door to deck, no pool towels without asking -- and asking again, an ant problem, overpriced food/beverages, etc). My main issue is that there are safety issues. The railings going into the pool (the more modern pool) were loose. I slipped on a "greasy step going into the pool" and injured my arm/shoulder when I grabbed for the railing. The maintenance man came and fixed only one railing! San Diego is a wonderful city and there are many accommodations to choose from. Buyer beware on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Dana”
Reviews.Author: whymeUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a two week holiday in California and stayed in 7 hotels. This was the worst one. The hotel is isolated and it didn't help that one of the restaurants was some times closed. We had to use room service, food was undercooked and of poor quality Staff on reception seemed uncaring and were full of their own self importance. Room was dirty and very noisy due to a highway close by. Rubbish from previous occupant still on floor. Under bed area very dusty. Blanket had knife ? holes in it and top bed cover had some very interesting (white) stains on it. Our voucher showed that we should have had a free breakfast, but we only got a $20 dollar reduction. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, get there early and stay in the new buildings.”
Reviews.Author: toy4runr85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided on something off the beaten path a little but not too far from Mission Beach. OK so we get there late (5:30) and are told there are of course no first floor rooms. Not surprised just disappointed. Easy to get in and you have a patio with access to the grass, however the people above us were loud and I questioned the security of the room as the glass door and patio are accessible to the public, it's a public park and ANYONE could walk right up to your door. They do provide a regular lock plus 2 auxiliary door locks but I was never truly secure. They do have safes in the room, be sure to use it for your smaller valuables (laptop, jewelry, etc). The room was fine as far as that goes. Bed was comfortable. However there were several lights that didn't work or the switches mysteriously either did nothing or did several things. Weird. The light in the shower was burned out as well as one of the lamps. The clock radio is a joke. The batteries in the TV remote were dead (I can't make this up) we used some spare batteries from our camera flash (they are AA in case you need to plan). Shutters partially broken the only way to make the left one work was to lift it and slide it. For the price and hype EVERYTHING should work. How hard is it to replace a battery or a light bulb? Internet access: B wireless? It's 2010 c'mon... I build computer networks and wireless hotspots for a living, and a G or N access point is stupid cheap. To add insult to injury they CHARGE for internet! Good thing I had my own broadband card. Ridiculous. We did however thoroughly enjoy the Firefly restaurant. I had the seafood boil and she had the filet, both were excellent and the creme brulee was fantastic! Service from the staff was fast and friendly. The Dana Inn has a little dock area right there at the hotel and they have boat and bike rentals, pretty neat. Nice area to walk around and you can take the public paths to go under Mission Bay Blvd to the other side of the bay. Nice views. I would consider staying here again. Maybe if we get in early, get a 3rd floor room and bring our own batteries... chuckle... Then again there are a LOT of other hotels around San Diego...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jcali25
Reviews.Content: Amazing views, nice rooms, and great location. My wife and I are already planning our next vacation to come back.

Reviews.Title: “International guests BEWARE. They charged me twice to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: beljoakes
Reviews.Content: International Guests BEWARE! Okay, so it has taken a while to write this review, but after staying for a really nice 4 day break on our first visit to the Us from Australia in June 2007, I was absolutely flabbergasted when the hotel had the audacity to charge me for the room again in the Novemeber of 2007. Now it is true that the hotels staff did put us in 2 rooms. At check in time, I did argue that Qantas holidays had only given us vouchers for one room, but the hotel said "no, you have two rooms". I argued again that we had only paid for one, but were told the booking was made for two rooms, so after arguing for a good 20 minÃºtes in vain, we took the second room with the understanding that this was covered by our booking and pre-paid vouchers. . 6 months later, I spent over two months dealing with my bank here in Australia, ringing San Diego and badgering Qantas, all to no avail. It cost me in the end around $800 for the room extra and $200 for the calls and loss of my time and patience. In defence of Qantas, they were exceptional, supplying me with dockets, booking references and everything they could to ensure that I was getting all the help I could from them. Qantas confimed they had only booked one room and had the documentation to back this up. The facts of the matter are, the staff in this hotel were incompetent, incapable and lied to international guests who had no way to defend themselves at a later date when they were out of the country . Instead of checking up with Qantas, as any good property would do and clearing it up, before the customer arrived the room was booked nearly 6 months in advance), The Dana waited 6 months and then slugged me the bill for almost$800 in a very sneaky and underhand way, as if I would not notice this on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAY ON THE BAY”
Reviews.Author: Williegeorge84
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a terrific find. The grounds have a island feel rather than a hotel feel. The hotel layout is filled with tropical plants and relaxed attitude. The people are always friendly and ready to help. The restaurant food is terrific and the staff friendly and efficient. The rooms are quiet and comfortable while lacking nothing. A walk around the grounds is relaxing and everyone we met were enjoying themselves. We will definitely stay there every time we are in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience...I highly recommend The Dana on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaC089
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 2 teenagers while checking out colleges...Every one I encountered at the hotel was helpful and courteous from the time we checked in until our departure. What a perfect location! Their free shuttle service took us right over to Sea World and picked us up at no additional charge. The view of Mission Bay is great...we rented waverunners onsight and this was not only reasonably priced but convenient. One night the hotel offered all of the guests a free movie night under the stars. The Blue Pearl restaurant had great food...Try their eggs benendict! We had a great room overlooking the pool and it was conveniently located to everything....Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, scenic, wonderful time at the Dana on Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: SoBlessed2010
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Dana Hotel on Mission Bay. We were in a Premium Bay View 2 Queen beds room (rooms 2201,2205-2207) with a group of 16 of us for four nights. Families with ages ranging from 6 years old up to mid 60's. The rooms in front of the bay were well furnished with a gorgeous balcony view of the bay. In room safe, mini bar fridge and microwave were all an added plus with plastic bowls, plates and cutlery for added convenience. We enjoyed the Fish and Chips place for supper twice as well as the Blue Pearl Restaurant for breakfast once. We loved being able to watch the fireworks from Sea World from the pool/hot tub or our balcony....so cool! Staff was very helpful with any questions or hiccups along the way...like when the in room safe wouldn't open (very quick service).Very beautiful hotel for the price! Excellent driver for the shuttle to airport and Sea World. Airport shuttle does cost $18 per room and we were advised to leave on shuttle 2 hours before we needed to be at the airport. Not needed at all as it is a 21 minute shuttle ride to the airport (at 6am). Otherwise..Had an excellent time! Loved the bike rentals and bike ride to Mission Beach and down the Boardwalk. Rented surf boards and boogie boards for our teens...great time! One day spent at Sea World too...very fun and wet! (Kids insisted we sit in the Soak Zone...they aren't kidding!) One day at San Diego Zoo. Took City Transit for a $5 per person all day bus pass. This took 3 transfers total to go one way and 45 minutes for teh one way ride but not bad for 2 adults and 4 kids. If you have less people, would recommend the taxi flat rate of $23 each way to the Zoo. Great place to stay...beautiful pool! Stay and have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “We have found our San Diego home at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixTraveler06
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Dana since discovering it in May of this year. We stayed in the premium king room each time. It was lovely, roomy with beautiful view of the bay. The balcony was an added attraction as we watched the beautiful sunsets. The fridge and microwave were an added bonus, we were able to eat in for breakfasts which was a pleasure as well as a savings. We swam in the heated pool next to the ocean, it was large and not crowded even on a Saturday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but Education is your Friend”
Reviews.Author: libertychef
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked three rooms for our family and for ourselves to celebrate our 40th anniversary. The rooms were the Deluxe Bay View Premium guest rooms which were located by the marina and provided magnificent views. The furnishing and decor were exceptional. The rooms contained a small refrigerator, a wet bar and microwave. The small sitting room provided an area that we could all meet for "happy hour." At around 10:00 each night, we could view the fireworks from Sea World right outside our patio. Parking was limited and we were charged $16.00 each for the first two days. I'm not sure why we were charged for only the first two days, but if you don't get back early to the hotel from your day and evening out, you will have to park quite far from your room. The girls at the front desk were adequate, but they certainly could have been a little more friendly and accomodating. We left our cell phone number because one room wasn't ready. Within a few minutes, while we were eating at their Blue Pearl Restaurant, we received a call that the room was available. After thirty minutes, we went to the front desk and were told that we had to wait a few minutes because some guests were removing their luggage from the room. (???) I'm not sure why they made the call to tell us the room "was ready." Of the three rooms, my husband and I had a first floor room. Thank goodness the rest of our family were on the third floor. However, we wanted this room so that we could walk out on the grass to the marina. This was a HUGE MISTAKE! If at all possible, never get a room on the first floor. The noise level from the guests directly above us was completely intolerable. Were they walking and throwing things exceptionally loud and on purpose? Were they doing anything extra, like jumping jacks or other exercises? I don't know...just be aware that you do NOT want a first floor room if you enjoy quiet and solitude when you can be alone. They had arrived quite late at night, after we had gone to bed, so this was truly an annoying situation. We complained two nights into our four-night stay, but were informed that there were no other rooms available. The last night was so horribly loud that I honestly thought I'd go sleep in the car. I would have, too, except the car was parked quite away from our room (see above advisory about getting back to your hotel room early). Upon checking out, we again complained and mentioned our previous complaint and lack of action. The management gave us a fraction of each nights' room off ($50.00) to placate us, but honestly, I don't think that made up for two nights of no sleep. So, to sum it up: EDUCATE yourself Be aware that you will pay $16.00 to park (times 2), and you may have to park quite a ways from your room. Also, you do NOT want a first floor room. If you are partially or completely deaf, however, this room would be delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience at the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: RodBe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newer section with a wonderful view of the bay. Nightly fireworks from Seaworld were visible from our balcony as well as the pool and hot tub. We asked to change rooms from a king to two queens and the staff were quick to accommodate. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenic location”
Reviews.Author: sobodad
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel on a scenic bay. The rooms are decent, but parking can be a little tight. The in-house restaurant was good, and the heated pool was excellent. Sea world is really 5 minutes away, and the beach about 10 minutes. The week we were there was a little cool (early July 2006 was cool weather) and there was an earthquake....but what the heck, this is California. All in all a good experience, and I would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “lovely vacation hotel, upgraded rooms definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Dana at Mission Bay. It is extremely convenient to Sea World, without feeling touristy or boxy, and also to Pacific Beach and La Jolla. When I booked I was offered the upgraded room for an extra $50/day, and was glad we did. The renovated and upgraded rooms are FAR better than the others available, which are dated. Beware...there are parking fees that you may or may not be told about! The hotel grounds and pool were delightful and we enjoyed walking over to the marina. There is a free shuttle to Sea World that came in handy . We also really liked the restaurant, and ate there twice. Definitely a great choice for a San Diego vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: mkarle
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to stay at the Dana on Mission Bay Hotel in San Diego. It is close to Sea World and the beach, and sits on the beautiful Mission Bay. The rooms are very nice with great views, and there are delicious restaurants to enjoy. The landscaping is gorgeous and all the staff are very friendly and helpful. My kids especially enjoy the pool and hot tub. Watching fireworks every night at Sea World is an added bonus. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed and more”
Reviews.Author: psdaskas
Reviews.Content: My running group stayed at this Hotel for the San Diego Rock 'n' Roll marathon. It was perfect. Their restaurant opened for dinner and offered a fantastic reasonable priced menu for runners! They had a great selection of pasta/ carb loading items to choose from. They also had a shuttle service that took us to the start line. Afterwards, there was not ANY hassle getting a later check out so that we could shower after our race. We runners REALLY appreciate that!!! Hotel was very nice, and I would stay there with my family for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.....Loved It”
Reviews.Author: CarolMRiverside_CA
Reviews.Content: We took our Grandson to San Diego and stayed at the Dana. Checking in, the staff was very helpful and polite. The grounds at the Dana are beautiful and very clean, the pool area was very nice. Our room was right on the bay and the view was beautiful. We spent a day at Sea World and the Dana offered free shuttle back and forth. The beds were awesome, very comfortable and full of pillows........If in San Diego again, we know were to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise of beauty and Oasis of rest!”
Reviews.Author: anabelle2
Reviews.Content: We came from dry ,hot Santa Fe ,NM to find Dana on Mission Bay to be a lovely Oasis. The staff was friendly and helpful. The gift shop had some unique gifts for friends and the food was terrific at the Blue Pearl. Sleep cameeasy while you listened to the seagulls.The price was amazingly afforadable . I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to attractions, beautiful views of Marina”
Reviews.Author: Trinighul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Bay View Rooms which was nice, clean and roomy, had a balcony and gave great views of the marina. Our package included breakfast at the Blue Pearl Restaurant a value of $15 per person, it would probably be cheaper if you dine there on your own as the breakfast portions are huge and can be shared. You have to pay for parking 3 days for the price of 2. Internet access is not free. There is a free shuttle bus to Sea World. Overall the experience was good, although front desk staff wasn't friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It's NOT a Hotel it's a second class motel”
Reviews.Author: Elephant04
Reviews.Content: Dana Hotel is never a Hotel it's a second class motel, noisy AC, broken door lookers, bad service and dirty pool area! We stayed there for 4 nights but we never will be go to this motel! For 200 $ per night normal you will get good and clean rooms! I can NOT recommend this Motel

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Dana - Pictures are deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: kathy93
Reviews.Content: They put me in a room in the "older" section (Building 800, 700 are the Older section)... the room had bugs, a refrigerator from 1970, a metal piece across the bathroom door so you souldn't shut it, and a space about 2 inches at the bottom of the outside door where all critters could enter. When trying to get another room, they would not let me move -(bug was on my pillow), until the next day, and would only take $50 off the $159 price - they admitted they wouldn't stay in that room themselves... musty smell, air conditioner was musty - gave me a cold... stay away from the Dana Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing-Easy drive to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: calaz04
Reviews.Content: Glad I did not stay on Hotel Circle- drove past that area on my way home. The Dana was very relaxing, clean and comfy- a little dated, but you did not have to pay the big resort fees. Easy drive to Sea World - not stressfull. The shuttle only had two drop off times and the pick up time would not allow you to see ShamuRocks. Used iphone and gps to find less expensive places to eat. Laundry room came in handy - got totally soaked on some of the rides - we were able to dry our jackets. A lot of airplane noise and kids running upstairs - if you don't mind it a little - this is a perfect place - I would go back again- with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Great Views, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: 1gammie
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were beautiful overlooking the marina. Granite counters and double sinks in the bathroom. Huge TV, coffeemaker, refrigerator, and robes. Comfy beds. The parking was conveniently located close to the rooms, and staff was helpful when we needed extra parking. The restaurant was wonderful, with generous portions and attentive wait staff. Just wish we could have stayed longer. Next time....

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and relaxing at the same time”
Reviews.Author: ShanMcD35
Reviews.Content: So I came here with 7 girlfriends. We got two rooms for three nights, and I could not believe the service we received. It's so rare to find places with employees who are smiling, not because they have to but because they are happy, and who ask you questions not because it's their job, but because they care what the answer is. Our private patio overlooked the bay and we were walking distance from Sea World, as well as a $10 cab ride from PB (split four ways made it nothing), which is where we spent most our days, walking around getting some drinks and some sun. I would recommend this place to anyone anywhere! Tip: Our room had a microwave as well as a fridge so take your leftovers back with you and maybe even some frozen dinners to save money :)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it here - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: bbr2996
Reviews.Content: We recently visited The Dana for a trip to San Diego to celebrate our son's graduation. It was fantastic!! We had two seperate rooms and they were both beautiful and clean with comfy beds/pillows and a beautiful view of the water. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful and the price couldn't be beat. We will definately be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for SeaWorld, adequate base to see rest of SD”
Reviews.Author: rendesvouz99
Reviews.Content: The proximity to SeaWorld is the main benefit of this resort hotel, its about a 15 minute walk or 5 minutes in the complimentary hotel shuttle service. To see the rest of SD, it is advisable to either hire a car, or you can use the hotel shuttle service to drop you near the cruise ship terminal or the Amtrak station for a fee which would be less than a taxi. The pool areas are well maintained, and although the rooms in the main block of the hotel are ageing, they are well kept. Breakfast at the in-house Blue Pearl is fantastic...set us up for the day very well.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the Bahia!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNiks
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a weekend at the Dana to make up for a trip we planned (and cancelled after seeing our filthy garden view room) last year at the Bahia. Much better! The rooms at the Dana are clean, nice, and updated. The location is perfect. The only complaint would be the noise level at night bc people were hanging out outside of our door. I try to make a trip down to San Diego at least twice a year and will most likely be booking at the Dana again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: wolfcall2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Dana, I wish it had been for the full 7 days. Everything was wonderful. We were in the newer section with a bay view on the ground level. It was quiet, close to the pool, spacious, clean and utterly wonderful. We had a gate leading from our patio to the grass, walking path and the bay. We couldn't go into the water because of the rocks but that was OK. We choose to use public transportation to go to Mission Beach and Old Town. It was easy and cheap. We didn't need to rent a car becaue with the bus system stopping just at the corner and a free shuttle to Sea World it was easy. We had breakfast most mornings at the hotel cafe, the kids menu was reasonable and they serve quickly which made it wasy to get our day going. We had dinner first night at the Firefly. It was good but the kids menu was limited. All in all a wonderful experience and will recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “a bit dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: arober
Reviews.Content: Our room was ok, and comfortable but it was set up like a motel with the entrances outside and we could hear everything outside our room. It sounded like a knock on any door was a knock on our door. They claim a "fitness room" but when I went looking a found a small locked room, empty except for an exercise ball and a water fountain. The smoke detector started beeping (low batteries?) while we slept, I called the front desk but they never sent anyone and my husband tore it off the wall and took the batteries out. It sat there on the nightstand for another couple of days! We went to the Blue Pearl for breakfast and I thought it was good, but the service left a lot to be disired, there was no refill on the water and our waiter was MIA. Also, the complimentary shampoo smelled like lemon dishwashing detergent and made my hair feel icky. That said, the location was nice and we rented bikes to ride to Mission Beach. Taxis into downtown were expensive ($25 before tip) so rent a car if you want to travel very far.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and great service!”
Reviews.Author: ljulian12
Reviews.Content: Over the weekend my friends and I spent my birthday in San Diego and stayed at The Dana on Mission Bay. The experience was wonderful. We stayed in a suite that overlooked the bay and public park where we could easily access public walking paths. The service was great. When we arrived the Guest Services Manager, Vanessa Borio, was very friendly and advised us on where to eat and always was quick to give us directions to places around town. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. If we needed linens or towels they were quick to arrive to our room with just that. All of the facilities on the premises were wonderful. We dined at the Firefly our first evening there and were very impressed with the restaurant, service, and food. The next morning we ate breakfast at the Blue Pearl and the food and service was great once again. The nicest thing about these eateries was that we never even had to get in the car. Everything was in walking distance. The trip was wonderful and the service contributed to our enjoyment. I would highly recommend The Dana on Mission Bay for those that are looking to travel to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: azalea1
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Very outdated, rude and uninformed employees and right next to the airport so all we heard were planes taking off and landing the entire time...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great views, poor sleep quality, $16/day for parking outrageous and $9.95/day for Internet, give me a break.”
Reviews.Author: DaleandDenet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week, picked the site because it was so close to Sea World. Would have been nice if their shuttle went to the Zoo as well. The room was on the re-modeled side, but you could see that they tried to make it look modern. The view of the Marina was beautiful and we were very close to the new pool and the newer rooms, so it felt better. The "tropical" pool was bad and there was no "exercise" room as stated. Beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were way to soft and the children just wouldn't shut up, stop running up & down the hall and slamming their room doors. The room had a rotten egg smell when the A/C was on, very disgusting. The room had a big flat screen TV and double sinks, plus they supplied very nice robes and beach towels for the pool and the very large spa. The new pool was heated and beautiful with the marina right there. I'd stay again, but be specific about staying on the new addition side of the hotel. It was great for the price of a week and close to all of the additional sites we wanted to visit. Would have loved to have my little daschunds with me. Dale & Denet (Visalia, California)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff, but some details...”
Reviews.Author: d33top
Reviews.Content: Super location and great for my tween and teen daughters. They loved the pools and the hot tub - the same areas were comfortable with me. We all loved the easy access to everywhere. We didn't rent a car the first 2 days and walked over to Mission Beach and visited SeaWorld. With the car, the city was easy to access (10 min to anywhere) and a short distance to Torrey Pines State Park, La Jolla, and Wild Animal Park. The hotel staff were very accomodating with information and requests (3rd robe, fix non workingn door lock, coordinate car rental). Nice restaurant with small limited menu and slow service at Firefly. Blue Pearl serves great breakfasts at reasonable city prices. The room - we did stay in the Marina Cove which I read and was told by Dana staff was renovated. I would say partially renovated myself. The rooms are nothing luxurious or spacious. They do have the fridge, separate sink area, microwave. The bathroom and door entry was redone The rest were pretty standard. We had a poolside view, which was nice to slip into the pool area through our patio. I would say I was disappointed by its standard appearance - I didn't think the hotel was cheap. Especially since asking that I would have a renovated room, I did expect more. The carpeted area was stained and the one of the bedcovers somewhat frayed. I did think the staff should do a bit more monitoring of the pool area at night when other guests were not always considerate of others (and it was 'closed'.) I did call the front desk one night and they promptly responded. However, it occurred again the same night and others. I would also agree with other reviews that there is a lot of noise between floors. The grounds of the hotel are nicely laid out and comfortable to walk around. They also have bike and water sport equipment rentals onsite. If the room was in better shape I'd give it Very Good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jljclark3
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Second time staying. Love the Bay view rooms. Very nice staff. Had a massage too. LOVED THE DANA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what an awesome stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nordski_gringa
Reviews.Content: There are two things that might influence our review, so judge for yourself . . .first is that we are budget travelers, and the Dana was our "splurge" at the end of our trip, and also we very luckily and undeservedly received a free upgrade to a Deluxe Bay View Suite (we had booked a Deluxe Bay View Room). So, after staying in a cheap hotel in Oceanside for 5 days, this place, especially the suite, seemed like the pinnacle of luxury. The beds were fabulously comfortable, with nice sheets and down blankets and pillows, the decor was modern and pleasing, the patio overlooking the bay was really nice, and the pool was warm, inviting, and beautiful. We even dined in the Firefly when we were too tired to go out, and the service and food were great. Nothing to complain about here - we had a magical stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: physiodude
Reviews.Content: Great spot overlooking the Marina with well appointed modern rooms. We had a Deluxe Bay view over looking the marina with breakfast and it was a great couple of nights. The pool area was nice, clean and sheltered from the wind. The grounds and facilities were well kept and the layout was fine once you got used to it. My only beef with the place is the internet and parking fees which add about $25/day to your room which I figure is a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: millerde1
Reviews.Content: Thought outside looked a bit shabby on arrival but got a room facing marina and it was lovely - towels and robes provided, fridge, microwave, coffee machine. Extended family's room was the same. Booked bed and breakfast and was given thirty dollars to spend in the restaurant for breakfast - it had a great choice and couldnt fault the breakfasts - we spent that for three people with a little bit more added. Very calm - would have liked to have gone in the hot tub but thought it was a bit chilly at night but there were plenty of people using the pool and hot tub area. Sat outside the firefly restaurant drinking and was warm enough under the patio heaters. Really liked the Dana and would definitely stay again. Reception staff were really helpful we expected to pay for parking the car but this wasnt added on at the end so must have paid it already. We paid approx Â£30ppn (three in a room) so we thought good value.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: 2catsontherun
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel - booked two suites, with water view. Got two rooms with view of the public bathrooms! Hotel moved us to upper floor with view, but no suite. Front desk employees not very knowable or helpful. I was very sick, and was told, Dr.s don't come to hotel and the emergency clinic is somewhere within 3 - 5 radius, if needed, call 911. Waited 1 hour for takeout, and then the food was cold and fries were mushy. Children swam in the pool and one evening found fetal matter in the bottom of the pool, when front desk was notified, they said "we take care of it' - in their own sweet time. Location was very pretty, but out of the way if you do not have a car. Buses, shut down every early in the evening, so you need to take cabs to get around. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you get an updated room”
Reviews.Author: Junegemini
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based upon online reviews and proximity to Sea World and other attractions. Traveled with my 11 year old daughter, my sister and best friend. The property is beautiful and quiet although located off a busy main road. We arrived late on a friday for check in, and our rooms were ready. Front desk staff very friendly. The first 2 rooms we had were TERRIBLE. Located in the 500 buidling, the rooms were old, musty, moldy and the carpet was filthy. Since it was late we stayed the first night but in the morning requested room changes with Rachel. Our new rooms were in the 200 and 400 building and were FANTASTIC! Clean and fresh. We used our fridge to hold milk, juice and snacks for breakfast and other times. Pros: Wonderful staff, across the street from Sea World, 2 restaurants were reasonably priced, spacious rooms with mini-fridge and microwave. Rooms are quiet. 2 pools and onsite laundry. Parking $32 per week ($16/night for the first 2 nights, then free after that). Onsite bicycle and water sports rental available. Family-friendly. Cons: Limited shuttle service to /from Sea World, all rooms not updated yet. No onsite food available after 9pm (unless vending machines are counted), No free wi-fi on property ($9.95/day access or wait in lobby to use hotel computer).

Reviews.Title: “felt let down”
Reviews.Author: moosejawtraveller
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews and knew to ask for the new section of the hotel. Our request was not received and we felt let down by a very old, shabby room. The room was clean and usually quiet during the night although one night had noisy neighbors. To us it was like a motel and not what we were expecting. It is very close to Sea World and offered a shuttle which we used. The kids enjoyed the heated pool. The package we had included a $20 credit each morning for breakfast. We used it 3 times in the 5 days. It tends to get a little boring for the food. If you are just there to sleep it's o.k. but I did feel let down. We paid $175 a night and got the 5th night free. You have to pay $16 for the first two nights of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeles_CACynG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana on Mission Bay for Spring Break and it was awesome. We had a poolside room with 2 queen beds and it was very reasonably priced. We were so close to everything and were able to go do many things and still have time at the pool everyday. We rented a pedal boat right on the hotel grounds to explore the bay. It was a great family-friendly hotel and the staff was great. Our children are 5 and 7 and can't wait to go back to San Diego so we can stay at the Dana again. Honestly, if it were up to them they probably would have never left the hotel during our 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: wicky144
Reviews.Content: We happen to stay at both the new and old section of the facility. The older section is just that--old. The newer section has a good bay view and the rooms are larger and nicer. That being said, the staff doesn't seem overly friendly nor is the lobby very inviting. The location is very good and very convenient to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful, relaxing time in beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: cruzinSantaCruz_Ca
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent 5 days at the Dana, relaxing, eating, sitting in the hot tub, walking along the water. There are two pools and two hot tubs and two restaurants. We were in the older section of the resort, and had some noise from next door neighbors and those above us. But we had a great first floor patio on a beautifully landscaped lawn. There were lots of young children and some older ones, mostly in family groups, but this was Spring Break after all. We didn't have a rental car, so we used a combination of ways to get around. The Dana is a little removed from the main action, which meant it was like a little beautiful oasis. We walked across the bridge to Mission Beach and spent a day lying on the beach and watching the people surf, and ate pizza at Gabbiano. We used city bus one day to Old Town, walked around, and then took the trolley to Maritime Museum ($5 day pass for both bus and trolley). Went sailing on the Californian (what a great adventure!), went to the Zoo (expensive taxi ride, but love the Zoo). The Dana has a shuttle to SeaWorld, but we didn't go there. Ate breakfast and dinner most nights at the hotel. Dinner quality was a little uneven, like maybe the fish or meat was great but the sides were just okay, but we ate outside and enjoyed the stars and enjoyed the convenience of being on site. Booked through Southwest Vacations and got a great package that included air, hotel, and $20 credit towards breakfast. We've been to San Diego several times, including business trips. Like the Dana a lot!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jojo3300
Reviews.Content: It was very nice there and we had a great time. From looking at the boats in the Marina or swimming in the Bayside Pool, this is a great hotel to stay at. The only thing I didn't like is it didn't have free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tuks-trips
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Dana. Right from the start they were very helpful and polite. Although they had no record of having an adjoining request with our friends, they were quick to change our rooms and accomodate us. We had an average type hotel room in the older, but renovated section. It was clean and decor was fine. The best part was that it was on the bottom level and opened onto our own patio and then onto a lush grassy courtyard close to the tropical pool. This was a great location for the kids. It was on the 400 building. There are other buildings/rooms on the property without such a nice view/location, so be sure to ask for what you want - we just lucked out! We had "free" breakfast for two adults included (booked through Alaska Vacations) and this was basically a $20 credit to their restaurant. With careful planning and sharing with kids, we were able to keep our additional cost below $5 (we also had food in the room for kids in AM too like yogurt and fruit). The Dana is a great location, only 5-10 minutes away from most places you want to go, but it feels out of the main city and it is right on the bay. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Enjoy at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: EllaBostonMA
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip. Since we are from Boston, we are not completely familiar with the area. We tried the Dana because we learned about Bartell Hotels through University of San Diego, where our son is a freshman. The website is great, but the Dana "live" was even more impressive than what we expected from the virtual depiction. We most definately will return. Thank you for all the friendly hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “$$16 Dollars to park per day. Are you kidding me !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: freezbaby
Reviews.Content: What"s next $$ for shampoo and towels? All kidding aside the stay here was nice I just wish they would have been more upfront with this uncustomery charge so i would have been prepared for the extra $112.00 to park my car. Nice location, clean rooms, very friendly restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Away from congestion, but close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: sunnytimes1126
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the proximity of the Dana to the beach, Old Town & La Jolla. We stayed in the king suite. The room was great,, clean, nice amenities. We thought only two down sides were that the restaurants were not that appealing....but there is a huge selections of great dining within a mile. Also the other thing wireless is a pretty easy thing to comp patrons but there is a daily charge...however we knew that going in and accepted the charge. But, what an easy thing to remedy considering you can go up to one of the coffee shops on the beach and get free WIFI. All and all a great small hotel, nice pool, hot tub and great location; close but away from all the congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Dana”
Reviews.Author: lutherfam4
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in San Diego, with easy access to SeaWorld. Love the view of the bay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in changes to services”
Reviews.Author: ubyouibme
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Dana many times in the last five years because my family likes the location near the water and away from many of the more touristy hotels. On our most recent visit we found out that the hotel has begun to charge $16 a night for parking and has discontinued room service. Adding the parking fee to the room rate means this hotel is not so much of a bargain in a nice location. And not having room service turned out to be quite an inconvenience on this latest trip away, being that my son became ill and we couldn't easily go out to dinner. I will look around before automatically booking a room at The Dana for our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 3-Star Hotel but felt like 5-Stars”
Reviews.Author: Marites8
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Diego, choose The Dana based on the reviews shown here at Trip Advisor (was in SD from Feb 11 to Feb 14). No regrets but the rooms whether you choose the non-view or courtyard were average. They both needed upgrading. Upside - beds very comfortable, it was great to have a microwave and refrigerator, spacious rooms, 2 huge, heated and clean pools (great for kids), $16 parking fee but it was good for us as our rental car from Enterprise for only $18. Downside, TV remote was useless, very limited TV channels, walls too thin so expect to hear every sounds (banging doors, arguments, loud noises). The property is near the marina so excellent for families to rent bicycles and boats and go for rides during the day. Only a 15-minute walk to SeaWorld and we did walk it both ways. It was a nice, safe leisurely walk, don't have to pay parking at SeaWorld or use the hotel's limited shuttle service. The Dana was very close to most amenities ie. major attractions, grocery stores, pharmacy, mall, beaches. Yes we will return to The Dana with no hesitation. The hotel was 3-star hotel but because the customer service was excellent it felt like a 5-star hotel to us. Staff were friendly, accommodating, understanding, speedy, efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: gardnerchuck
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! Cant say enough about the staff. Smiles all around. The location next to the water is great. Easy access to Mission Beach and Sea world. Clean all over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place unless you want to be connected”
Reviews.Author: tbrooksher
Reviews.Content: We just finished staying at the Dana for four nights. It's a nice hotel, very friendly staff, good restaurant, overall a very good experience EXCEPT there's virtually no AT&T cellphone coverage--regular or 3G, and virtually no Verizon wireless data coverage. They have wireless internet but charge handsomely for it. So if you're looking for a place to get away, this is the place. If you need to be connected, you'll be very frustrated.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful setting on Mission Bay with so many outdoor activities at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: mar550
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful room overlooking Mission BAY. Great food at a restaurant on the property. There was a problem with the first room and I was changed to another room even better than the first. Great location. So much to do in san Diego

Reviews.Title: “The Quiet Giant”
Reviews.Author: droid10
