I ate at the Blue Pearl several times and the food was standard US fare, but wasn't bad. I didn't eat at the Firefly. I would say that the new pool was very nice, very big and well maintained. I wouldn't really have many complaints about the Dana if it advertised itself as a 3 star hotel and cost $90 a night - but it cost $160 a night for me and claims to be a 4 star. I think you could easily find better in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: royalgrl13
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a wonderful hotel that comes with great views of the bay. The rooms are always clean and the staff are very friendly! I have stayed at the Dana numerous times and always enjoy my stay. The rates are reasonable and the food at the two restaurants are delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sanford21
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay in. We stayed in the 2300 block for four nights, no complaints. Great view of the bay from our balcony, we watched sea lions and dolphins swim by numerous times. The room was clean, current and fresh with kitchenette and plenty of room. The Blue Pearl restaurant is a short walk through the complex and has great food and service. If we ever go back to San Diego this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again... and again... and...”
Reviews.Author: jakobsloth
Reviews.Content: What an amazing setting for a hotel - having stayed in various hotels in San Diego over the year I must say - the Dana is by far the best hotel we have stayed. Oh, and the upgrade to a larger room helped too! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Dana”
Reviews.Author: VacationingChris
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Dana. We stayed in an attractive premium bay view room which looked newly renovated. Our room was in the 2100 block. The large room had a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, sink, and plenty of cupboard space. The room had a large tv, two very comfortable queen beds, a table with two chairs, a sofabed, and a coffee table. The bathroom was medium sized and looked recently updated. The air conditioning unit , unfortunately, was a bit loud. The view from the room was fabulous. The large patio overlooked a grassy area and the bay. The pool areas were clean and very inviting. The grounds were nicely landscaped with lots of flowers and foliage. The staff was friendly and efficient. We definitely look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: summergirlfromDE
Reviews.Content: This place is great! The staff is very friendly. We did not meet 1 person who was anything but sweet. There are 2 pools so it wasn't too crowded. I was there with a girlfriend but there was a good mix of all ages. It's close to everything and very very clean and nice. The rooms were almost like a villa, get the second floor because the roof is wooden and vaulted and beautiful. The restaurants were good (a bit pricey) but I loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly007
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at The Dana. We chose it because of other positive reviews. We were going to upgrade our room because of some reviews of the standard rooms, but we had a lovely room with a nice patio and great garden view - quiet and we could see the fireworks from SeaWorld at night. The Dana is in a great location - right on the bus route, water. It was easy to get around in San Diego. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Gary the shuttle driver was a huge help with tips and recommendations of restaurants, etc. Rooms were nice, clean, beds were comfortable. Overall, a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LVSaint
Reviews.Content: Took one of the cheapest rooms located in the block to the north east of the smaller pool. Room 217 second floor. Accessible from outside landing. Away from the noise of the poolside but close enough to get to within a minute. Might get a bit of noise from around the outskirts of the hotel as it is public land (as are the areas around a lot of these waterfront hotels in Mission Bay) but this did not pose a problem. Room although small was nicely renovated and comfortable with fridge and large flatscreen TV. Beds were fine. Small bathroom adequate. No free wifi and $12 day but for the low price, not a big problem. Will return! (Try to get the room next door on the end to have the additional window over the marina.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay after initial disappointment”
Reviews.Author: izzyHull
Reviews.Content: We travelled here in mid april, myself, wife and 2 kids aged 13 and 10 for a 3 day break whilst staying with relatives in California. We had booked on the springtime stimulus package which meant paying the amount upfront. When we arrived at reception we were informed we had booked for 2 rooms. After going away to see someone in the office the chap on reception told us that we would still have to pay for one extra night for the unused room. Not a great start to the holiday which meant me hanging around in reception for nearly 3 hours as I was not prepared to pay, meanwhile leaving my family back in the room with my young daughter in tears. This was eventually sorted though and I must say the manageress who saw me was very efficient and polite. When we got settled in we realised the safe was not working so had to call reception, the guy who came was quick and again very polite. The room we booked was lovely, a duluxe balcony room with 2 queen beds. The only downside was there wasn't an extractor fan which meant opening the balcony doors each time we took a shower, normally not a problem but it was a bit chilly on our stay. The beds were very comfy and the hotel grounds were well kept. All the staff we met were great from the cleaners to the managers, a nice touch being the helpful concierge at reception. As mentioned the grounds were lovely and both pools were great. We used the marina pool which the kids loved especially the jacuzzi, all with complimentary towels. The package itself was good value and meant us being able to book a better room whilst also getting $25 a day towards food etc. We used the blue pearl for breakfast which was efficient with nice food. We did use the firefly restaurant but only for a nightcap as it was a bit too over priced, the staff in here were lovely and made us feel very welcome. Whilst here we visited Seaworld using the complimentary shuttle bus which was well organised ,again with a friendly face behind the wheel. We also did the zoo and the old town which is a must. We would have liked to have done more including hiring bikes to do the trip around Mission bay (28 miles in total we were told) but the weather held us back a bit. The Danas location for us was great and everything was within easy reach with a car, the only negative was you had to use the car even on a night as everything was further along the beach. In the end I'm glad we chose the Dana which looks impressive from the outside and doesn't disappoint on the inside especially when passing other contenders for our booking on mission bay. I hope this review does not come across as being too negative as we would certainly recommend it to anybody wanting to visit San Diego/Mission bay. The parking at $12 a day seemed a bit excessive but I guess this is pretty much the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JojoDavis_California
Reviews.Content: Got a Travelzoo special; worth it. Very clean and attractive grounds. Worried that older rooms would be outdated. They were great. Very clean. Comfortable beds (pillows okay). Loved the tropical pool/spa, complimentary towels, and bar. Infinity pool is not that great. Looks over docking area, fenced in, doesn't overlook water like higher end tropical resorts. Room service food was very fresh and yummy. Free shuttle to SeaWorld. $6 shuttle to and from airport. $25 food credit with Travelzoo special paid for a round of drinks at the tropical pool. $12 parking a night seemed excessive

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Dana for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug0600
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana this past weekend from a Thursday night to a Monday morning. We were in the older part of the hotel, but it was a great price for the room. The service was great, breakfast was good as well at the Blue Pearl. We had a few people in the pool until past it's closing time that were being loud, but when we called the front desk, security went out there right away. The conceirge helped us with reservations and what things to do see and do. The rooms were great. we were in the 300 block of old rooms and while you could tell they were older, they were still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing with Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: strivingtorelax
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Dana. We enjoyed staying there so much, we had to stay again. Our room in the newer section, (which is the only section we have stayed in), was clean and spacious with a microwave and mini-fridge. The view each day from our patio, supplied with chairs and a small table, was breathtakingly beautiful. We found both pools to be extremely clean and inviting with lush, tropical landscaping. The surroundings provided a tranquil atmosphere that allowed us to truly relax. We would definitely stay there again, and recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but under flight path”
Reviews.Author: bakpas
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice motel, with nice views overlooking the marina. Only two reasons we might not stay here again are 1. Bit far out of town but good if you just want to go to Seaworld 2. Underneath the flight path We live on a main road at home so are used to noise but the planes were quite low and frequent. But if you can put up with these two things it's a good place to stay. The porter was a great guy and deserves a pay rise-one of the nicest Americans we met pity we can't remember his name!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnerTx
Reviews.Content: The desk personel were super and worked very hard to meet our needs. The rooms with 2 queen size beds were just alittle tight, so we changed to a room with a king and it was nice and big. The central location was great, since our plans included Sea World and a wedding at Marina Village and of course, the beach. It was great having 2 places onsite to eat at. We enjoyed dining at the Blue Pearl where the food and service was very good and at night it was an easy stroll over to the Firefly for evening cocktails. The gardens,pools and walkways are loaded with beautiful plants and trees with some nice spots to sit and take it all in.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SammyIsAWhale
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay has been our family vacation place for the last 4 years and we plan on that being the case for many more to come. Our most recent trip was in March 2009 and it was as awesome as our first. Located in beautiful Mission Bay we are within a mile of the beaches and right next door to SeaWorld. If we feel like staying around the property we can entertain ourselves by renting motor boats, bicycles, paddle boats, jet skies, or just enjoy relaxing at one of their great pools. The staff has always been professional and courteous whether they are working at the front desk, delivering room service, or brewing their fantastic coffee in the gift shop. The Dana on Mission Bay is truly our home away from home and the only problem we ever have is leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - incredibly noisy though”
Reviews.Author: ahcrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for 4 nights as part of a California holiday. The staff there were really lovely and very helpful, including at the restaurant. The room was dissappointing though - very basic and by the time we got a baby cot in there, there was really no room to get around, we had to clamber over beds to get to the bathroom, and somehow the shower always managed to flood the bathroom floor, and as there was no drain we had to put the towels on the floor each day so that we didn't slip over, just generally annoying. However the main problem we had with this hotel was the noise. We were upstairs at the end of a block and the noise from people walking up and down the stairs was bad - but the noise of the traffic outside was unbelievable. If you are staying here do not stay in the 500s block., it really was one of the noisiest hotels I have ever stayed in. I think if you were in one of the blocks with the marina view or pool view it would have been much nicer in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Twenty3Skidoo
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through AAA. I knew we would be in good hand when I had to contact the hotel directly to change the dates because the staff was so helpful. When we got lost trying to find it (our fault), another staff member stayed on the phone with me until we found it. I should add, the hotel is NOT hard to find. From check-in to check-out, we enjoyed every moment we were there. Our newly remodeled large room had an amazing view of the bay (we paid a little extra for it and it was worth it to see the sunset every night), the bed was comfortable (with lots of extra pillows), food service was totally reasonable (not something we usually take advantage of), the Blue Pearl restaurant was great (especially our breakfast experiences there because of the staff) and had a diverse enough menu to satisfy our taste. I really can't say enough about our stay. The staff at the Dana makes the hotel even more worth it. Another example: after we checked out, my husband thought he left his cell phone in the room. The concierge helped me try to find it in our room. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest place we've stayed in San Diego. Right on the bay!”
Reviews.Author: dianeg0123
Reviews.Content: Reserve your room so you look out on the bay or the marina. Take time to walk around the marina and enjoy the boats.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disgusted.”
Reviews.Author: Lindz32109
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked three nights at the Dana as part of our honeymoon. I work for a travel agency and I read the reviews, looked at pictures, etc. Everything seemed great and the price was right. We checked in and the front desk staff was really friendly and the main office was really nice! We were really excited to begin our stay in San Diego. However, we started the journey to our room, we had a marina view. The place was gross!! The buildings looked like something out of a horror film with the doors on the outside. But, we went in the room with an open mind. The room was tiny, the bed was on wheels, there was a sliding door to the bathroom with duct tape on the handle, and there was a dead bug floating in some leftover water in our shower. In addition, there was a gap of about 3-4 inches from below the door where any sort of critter could get in. We decided to stay the night since we had already paid for it and cancel our reservations for the next 2 nights. It was the worst nights sleep I had. The pillows were old, cheap and flat and the bed was one step up from sleeping on plywood. We could not wait to check out!!! We never ate at the hotel, so I am not sure about the restaurants, but the bathroom amenities were very nice. I am disappointed, when I gave my honest review to the hotel I never heard anything back from them! I probably wouldn't have posted this review had a manager followed up with me!! Definitely put up the money and stay at the Del Coronado, that's what we did and it was absolutely PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful, and most relaxing place!”
Reviews.Author: fred83060
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit and I never thought it could get better but it did. The staff at the Dana Inn was the best and actually helped me save money on our family package to Sea World. o the entire staff at the Dana Inn... we thank you deeply for the wonderful service and going the extra step to be so helpful. "A Job Well Done" and we look forward to our next visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GetmeouttaMN
Reviews.Content: I found a fantastic rate for the Dana over Spring Break 2009. I booked a deluxe premium bay-view room with a breakfast package via a booking engine which made it quite clear what I was booking and paying for, but I checked Trip Advisor just the same. What I found was alarming, as several people were claiming a "bait and switch" done by the hotel upon check-in. My only thought on this is they booked the lowest rate on any given reservation site, but on researching many sites, could not find one that wasn't clear about the room being booked. My advice would be to specifically book a room in the Water's Edge buildings, specifically a premium bay view if you want the best view of the bay. If you're concerned about cost, book the cheaper, older rooms in the old section, but expect to get what you pay for. In our case, we feel we got MORE than what we paid for. We got exactly what we booked upon check-in, experienced GREAT service from everyone from front-desk clerk, to maid service staff, to the bartender at Firefly, the shuttle drivers and EVERYONE at the Blue Pearl. I find that if employees are treated with cheerfulness and respect, you'll generally get the same back. The breakfast package was a total of $60 for our room, which was enough to feed our family of 4, and was very good. We ordered dinner to go, and that was excellent, also. The service was fast and friendly, almost classy, given the fact it's a casual, family-friendly eatery. We only had drinks at Firefly, but as I said before, the bartender was fantastic, the drinks were great, and he even found us some bread and dipping oil. The pool by Firefly is the better pool of the two available because of the view of the bay and the fact that it's lit at night. The Tropical Pool at night was a little creepy and dark, but would be nice during the day. All-in-all, our experience at The Dana was excellent, we would stay here again especially if the rate we got became available again, and my only disappointment was that we didn't spend our entire vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 2girlsandmom
Reviews.Content: We went to the Dana on the spring break weekend. it was a nice stay, Eco friendly toiletries, the marina view was great. we got $25.00 incentive towards the restaurants, good food. The blue pearl closes at 9:00 pm and they were friendly and nice to take my to go order at 9:15pm . thumbs up! the pool looks nice, did not have time to go. they have a shuttle to take you to the seaworld. my only problem with the room was the furniture, if you pass by the armoire, it makes a squeak sound and you think that it might fall on you ! Parking fee is 12 dollars per nite, thumbs down ! if you are going to the seaworld , san diego zoo and wild animal park, Costco sells the 3 parks pass for $85.00, it is a huge discount, same pass at Seaworld counter costs 115.00

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: DeaconFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during our stay in San Diego. We had a bayside room and the accomodations were excellent. The heated pool was a treat for the kids. The room was very clean and the location of the hotel was great for our trips to the SD Zoo and Old Town. Also, not far from Mission Beach and it's a great location to take a run on the beach! The Blue Pearl restaurant on location was very good for breakfast. For the quality of the room and ammenities, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Oo138oO
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute arrangement since our San Francisco trip was cancelled. My husband booked this hotel the morning we left the house so we didn't have a chance to do much of a research. Location.. Next to the Marina. If you're looking into launch your boat or anything that requires boating, this might be your perfect place. Otherwise, it is close to Sea World, it does offer shuttles from hotel to Sea World three times in the morning and three times in the afternoon. Departure times are 9:30, 11:30, and 12:30, returning time 4:30, 5:30 and 6:30 (could be a bit off since I'm working off of memory at the moment). Since we have smaller children we prefer not to take the shuttle for the flexibility, so on top of the parking we're paying at the hotel, we're also paying for the amusement park parking. Walking is 15 mins or so, which also doesn't work well with younger children. There are kayak and bikes for rental, but scenery is much limited. Our kids looked at the boats for about 2 minutes and got bored with it. There aren't any shops to browse. Hotel room: We paid the $40 upgrade to get the Marina view room. Let me describe the buildings first. It reminds you of those motels you have a open walk way and everyone's windows are facing the walk way. If you don't open up the shutter blinds the room would be quite dark, but once you do, you're pretty much open to the entire building guests that walks by.. trust me, everyone walks by just couldn't resist to take a look into your room. Since the walkway is open to the parking right infront of the building, you hear people talking in the parking lot on top of the activities in the hallway. Lucky us happens to have some guests yelling from parking lot to building 1am in the morning. Our room does have marina view... but you have to leave the blinds open to see through the hallway to see it, which was total waste to us. I do noticed a newer building somewhere on premise, but I do not even want to know how much more it would cost us. Room is quite cramped. Two beds fills up the whole room, and they managed to squeezed a tv and seating into it which makes it impossible to move around with the 4 of us. My side of the bed which is close to the window barely allows me to stand up and walk sideways, and I'm a skinny person. Windows shakes when our neighbors slams the doors or stomps in the hallway. Bedding is firm, and pillows are small and fillings aren't fluffy anymore. Room seems pretty clean, our feet stayed clean even though we're walking barefeet. I've stayed around San Diego area numerous times. This is the first place I'm incredibly disappointed with and will not return. It truely made me feel like I'm staying in a motel 6. We paid $156 plus $10 plus parking which we could've paid for a larger, more recognized hotel that we stayed in before.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: travelingman024
Reviews.Content: Being a business travel there is not a lot it takes to make us happy. Every employee I spoke to understood my concerns and problems did apoligize and that is where it stopped unless iI was willing to pay more money. I am still here as I write this because I am fustrated with the fact we are in a little down turn in the economy and these people could care less for repeat business.The room I was put in smelled of bleach and clorine. It was a total washed out beach resort with a pretty cover. My wife was going to fly out here and meet me as I have been on the road for a couple of weeks and I told her not to bother. I said we would come back and stay somewhere nice. Food was so so. The customer service is what was lacking. The hyatt across the street is a better bargain for the additional. A holiday inn is a better bargain. This from someone who was not footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: boxercrazyIndiana
Reviews.Content: Every time I visit my son in San Diego I stay at the Dana. Excellent accommodations, great location, friendly staff, good food and appealing grounds. I wouldn't and don't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana”
Reviews.Author: rtcBC
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days at the Dana yesterday, March 19. When checking out we were asked if there was anything they could do better and we couldn't think of anything! There are definitely two classes of rooms, which we were aware of from trip advisor when we booked. We booked a bay view room for 179US a night which included a breakfast at Blue Pearl restaurant of $15 each. We did get our price on our room by speaking directly to a person at the hotel who offered that price. The next day they offered the same deal but $10 more, so we told them that we had the offer of $179 and they gave it to us for that price. Blue Pearl is not a fancy restaurant, but the food was great, we had fabulous breakfasts for under our $15 allowance. Our room #1301 was on the 3rd floor (highly recommended to be up high) with a small balcony, close to the city park, but had a view of the bay. If I could stay at one of the buildings further to the north, it would be better, as they have a more direct view of the bay. The room was spacious, clean, well kept, tastefully decorated. People we met in the hot tub stayed at the remodeled rooms and said they were like a Motel 6, but clean and convenient. The trip from the airport cost us $12 total (not each as we had thought) The cab is about $22. We just went to information at the airport and they phoned the Dana for us and they came in about 20 minutes. Friendly service in all that we did.The shuttle going to the airport was on the hour, so we caught one at 4pm yesterday. We walked to Seaworld the first day and last day (it's more than 10 minutes, but it's fine) took a shuttle back. The free shuttles are posted 9:45 and 10:45 I think going, and 3:45 and 5:45 coming home. Seaworld has a promotion - pay for one day and have the rest of 2009 included! It was $65 but we got a discount because of AAA membership. So we went twice, enjoyed it immensely. We took the Old Town trolley tour the second day, it was $32 and they had a pick up at the hotel at 8:30 or 9:30. We took a route through Mission Beach area to pick up others, it was nice to see the different hotels. Got off at Old Town, Seaport Village, and the Coronado. It was busy and had to wait for trolleys to pick up, but all in all worth the money. We rented bikes at the Dana, $14 each for two hours but once we got going we didn't want to come back, so we paid $24 each for just over 4 hours. (bike lock and helmets included) We biked to Belmont Park and the Mission Beach area, and biked on the boardwalk for hours. We loved it. People are biking, jogging, walking, sunning (even though it was very foggy this day), surfing, etc. You just have to go up over the bridge when you first start and then after that it's all quite level. Ate at the Firefly pool side restaurant, they had bottles of wine half price that Wednesday, the food flavours were fantastic. Check on the calendar they have in the room for special deals at the restaurant. One of the only disadvantages of the Dana is that it is quite far out from other restaurants. You could bus in to Mission Beach for their restaurants, or take a cab or transit for others. If you had your own car, you of course would have more freedom. We did go to the Hyatt across the street for their pool side lounge, they do have a nice fancy restaurant, but we did not eat there on this trip. If we stayed longer we would go into town on the transit, there is a bus right across the street, and an all day pass costs $5. The concierge gave us instructions on how to bus it to the Zoo, which we did not have time for as the week went so fast! We also could have visited the zoo on our old town trolley tour if we had been better organized and earlier. Hope you enjoy your stay at the Dana. I can see how each experience and vacation would be different for everybody, and we loved our stay at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel,Staff Leaves Much To Be Desired,Beware of Rooms Adjacent to Park”
Reviews.Author: beefydoc
Reviews.Content: The best thing the Dana has going for it is it's location. I arrived after traveling from the east coast with my wife and 3 kids. I had found a good rate about 2 weeks prior to arriving and checked out reviews on tripadvisor and discovered there seem to 2 distinct class of rooms here.Those that have been renovated on the bay, and those that have not. We arrived around lunchtime andI was immediately informed the great rate I got was for an older room and that they would gladly upgrade me to a bay view room for another $50/night. With the reviews fresh in my mind, I upgraded but I really felt as though I was being played, like this goes on all day with peolpe that have gotten good online rates for the inferior rooms. It really felt like a bait and switch. Being early , I was told our room was clean but had not been checked yet. My wife was not feeling well and I asked how long it would be ( realizing we were there about 3 hours before check in. I was told "about an hour." We decided to get some lunch at Ocean Beach hoping that all my wife needed was some food after a long day of travel. We got back about 2 hours later and my wife had a migraine at this point and really needed to lay down. I went to the desk ,told them my wife was ill and asked if I could check in. I was told the room still had not been checked. When I reminded the woman at the desk that she had told me the room would be ready an hour ago., she very sternly told me we were sill about an hour or so away from official check in time. Let me say, I am a stern believer in "Don't tell me what you can't do, tell me what you can do". This person seemed unwilling or unable to expedite our check in or to find us another room. Finally after about 30 minutes we were able to get our keys to our room. Imagine my surprise to find our room did not overlook the bay, but instead overlooked a public park. Beware that in the renovated building that has the upgraded rooms, the left one-third of the building does not overlook the bay, but a public park. Our ground floor room had a sliding glass door that opened right into the park. Needless to say we did not feel great as we saw a few homeless people walk by our patio during our stay. That being said, the room was clean and the kids enjoyed the pool. The location is hard to beat. However the staff needs some major training, and if you stay in the renovated rooms you will have to pay an upgrade and try to stay on an upper floor away from the public park.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff,good price,good food”
Reviews.Author: Joandarcy
Reviews.Content: The Dana staff went that extra mile to take care of our needs.They have several lodging packages, we chose the stimulous package. It gave us $25 toward meals every day. It made a real difference in cost. The Blue Pearl restaurant had excellent food. We tried many of the dishes on the menu, they were all great. The Dana is within walking distance of the Marina Village Conference center, it's a beautiful place to walk. Colorado Birdwatcher

Reviews.Title: “The View is About the Only thing Going for it”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: we'd read the reviews, and we learned that there had been major remodeling done to part of the hotel, so we asked to stay on that side. They wanted an additional $45 per night/per room (we had 2) so we decided not to. They wanted this extra fee Despite the fact that the weather was Cold and the hotel had very few guests. We should have demanded a free upgrade; the "old" rooms were terrible. Noisy, thin walls, Horrible Shower that leaked all over the floor > into the carpeting...(except 1/2 the water came out of the Tub Faucet and wouldn't get up to the Shower Faucet). Service: I called the front desk so many times I lost track! Asked for a hair dryer-Never got it. Asked for an iron (there was an ironing board) Never got it. Room Keys stopped working almost every day we were there, and had to have someone come and "re-set" them. Fuse Blew: twice. I sat in the dark till a maintenance man came. Housekeeping didn't show up to clean my room 'til 4:30 in the afternoon. They charge extra for everything; parking, shuttle, internet access, "fees" etc. The location is beautiful, but I've stayed in several places in San Diego and considering the cost, condition of the place and the poor service, there are many other places I'd recommend before sending friends here.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay at The Dana for Sea World/Legoland/San Diego Zoo Trip!”
Reviews.Author: AliceinDisneyland
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: Clean, 3-star motel walking distance to Sea World. Location: Across the street from Sea World (10 min walk to gates; 15 if you miss the light.) 30 min from Legoland. 10 min from San Diego Zoo. Room: Very clean--no dust even on top of the armoire or behind the fridge. There was mold on the window frame behind the plantation shutters in the bathroom. Fridge and microwave. BYO pillows--hotel pillows looked fluffy but were lumpy. Beds were satisfactory. Bathroom appeared recently remodeled with granite vanity counter and faux marble tiled shower. Premium toiletries replaced each day as needed. Door closes off toilet/shower area; sink is open to the room. No street noise, and even with pool view room and lots of pool activity, no noise issues. Parking: Reported to be $12 per night, but we were not charged for parking at checkout. Shuttle service to Sea World with a personable driver. Restaurants: 2 restaurants on site, plus a deli/mini market. The Blue Pearl: casual dining, bored staff, more or less kid-friendly. The Firefly: better service and ambiance. Housekeeping/Front Desk: Efficient, fast, and friendly. We requested extra coffee packets upon check in and the housekeeper beat us to our room. Another housekeeper delivered an extra stash first thing in the morning without being asked. Every item we requested was delivered within 5 minutes. Grounds/Pools: Beautifully maintained landscaping and pools. We visited the large spa each night; towels provided. Poolside bar was open on Friday night. Cost: Got our room for 4-night stay on arestravel for 50% off--paid 69/night weeknight and 89 on Friday night. Would willingly stay again even at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary celebration at The Dana!!”
Reviews.Author: sassysasha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at The Dana to celebrate our anniversary. We had an awesome time!! The view from our room was incredible and we had a great balcony to sit on so that we could truly enjoy the view. The room was very modern and comfortable. We ordered room service the next morning to have breakfast in bed. We were not completely satisfied with our meal but the second that the staff heard about this they completely comped the whole meal!! The pool that over looks the marina is so relaxing as well. We will definitely go back to The Dana again sometime in the near future. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone that is looking for some place to just go and unwind. The staff is very attentive and friendly, always wanting to make sure that you have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location / Our best stay in San Diego by far!”
Reviews.Author: Regenerate
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Dana was far better than I could have imagined. My room had a fabulous view of the bay. My two year old could not get enough of the sail boats passing by. It was the most fun we have had in years. The pool area was great and very kid friendly. We ate at the Blue Pearl on the grounds and again, very kid friendly and fabulous food. The staff was very attentive, the food was fabulous. Highly recommend the chicken tortilla soup. The nachos were also a great hit. The salmon and Mahi Mahi were also very well prepared. I truely appreciated that there was something for all of us to enjoy. we had a wide variety of age groups with our party and everyone was very satisfied. I must say that although our room and the staff were fabulous the grounds were so soothing. I will miss those walks by the bay as my 2 year old scootered yelling Mommy sail boats, sail boats mommy. Will definately be coming back for more over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: Mpls2Maui
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I visited San Diego for a couple of days. We wanted to go to the zoo, and wanted to stay somewhere with a nice view of the water. The Dana fit the bill. We bought a package through the San Diego Zoo website that included one night at the Dana and four tickets for the zoo at a good price. The view was great. Our room overlooked the marina. Some rooms do just face a parking lot though. The rooms have outside entrances, which I don't like because of noise and safety concerns, but we didn't have a problem. The Dana is within walking distance to Sea World, and I think the hotel provides a shuttle as well. Definitely have breakfast at the Dana's restaurant, the Blue Pearl. Excellent food, great service, and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana was wonderful during our Christmas Holiday Trip”
Reviews.Author: ACALIFNative
Reviews.Content: The Dana was everything we needed and the view was extra special. We stayed at this hotel on Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and the day after. Our plane was very late in arriving on the 24th and when we called the hotel and said we were still arriving (9:45p.m.) they were delighted to hear from us and said we will continue to hold one of their nicest rooms for us. The check-in and check-out was seamless, and both times we were greeted by very happy people who enjoyed their jobs. The rooms without a bay view seemed a little older, so I recommend the bay view. Two very small problems in our room was one of the water glasses was chipped. I left a note for housekeeping but they did not see it. The other was the coffee pot needed a little scrubing -no problem we did it ourselves. The Mission Bay view we had was wonderful and the patio with chairs gave an initmate setting. The concerige sent me an email when we arrived home. I mentioned that we had a Lovely time and enjoyed the surroundings, the bay, pool, restaurant & bar. I told her that our room was wonderful, but I thought they should check for the chipped glass & coffee pot. The concerige emailed me back and gave us a percentage off of our next stay. This gesture was very much appreciated, and we would stay at this hotel anytime with a discount or not. You get LOTS for your money at this hotel and we will recommend them highly.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay at the Dana, absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: Devi8or
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana from 2/12-2/14 and found it to be a great place. We had booked a really good deal for the deluxe bayview room for a little over $200 for the 2 nights. The front desk staff was excellent and seemed to work in a timely manner. One of the attendents gave a goodie bag to my daughter upon arrival. The room was great, as I said it was the deluxe bayview room, in the newer building. It was a big size room for me, my wife and our 2 girls (ages 3 and 7 mos). The room was clean, comfortable and had a great view. It included a fridge, microwave and a sink, plus a decent sized balcony overlooking the bay. Travel to other places was a breeze as well. Sea World is a mere 3-5 minute drive if that long. We did the SD zoo also, which was within 15 mins also. Great place, would definately stay there again, but probably only in the newer side of the complex.

Reviews.Title: “decent room horrible service but good buy”
Reviews.Author: poof35
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent I recently stayed at the Dana. I was really impressed with the service upon check in and then things just started down hill. While the location is wonderful and very centerally located to everything the service and the amenities are a lot of talk and not a lot of action. They claim to have a shuttle service to Sea World which is very limited at best. 2 drop offs and 2 picks ups per day. We we suprised at how on time the shuttle was this morning. However, on the 4:45 afternoon pick up the shuttel was over 25 minutes late and only had a 3 minute drive. It took more then 3 phone calls to the hotel to get the driver to leave the hotel. Upon arrival back to the hotel I asked to speak to the manager on duty who was not pleasant. He apoligized telling us the shuttles are approx. Well the paperwork we were given was very percise and said that we were not to be late. Then when we did not go for that excuse we were told that the shuttle was tied up with airport runs. If you have a shuttle that has specific times you make sure to be there and you don't schedule airport runs at the same time. The manager was barely even apologetic for the error. As for the rooms the hotel was a little run down. The bathroom walls are patched and the windows leak when it rains. The hotel could use some updating but it was a clean and comfortable room for the money. The hotel business center is hardly a business center. It is one computer that you can use in the middle of the lobby. where anyone and everyone can see you type. I would caution you to becareful with the shuttle. It is three minute ride that takes over 30 minutes. It may be worth it to pay for the parking at sea world. Also, the parking fee at the hotel is not known when you book so be prepared to pay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff and accomodations are both comfortable, friendly and relaxing. The front desk folks and wait staff are pleasant, friendly and treat guests as guests, not customers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeannieEastDennis
Reviews.Content: It was a great Hotel!!!! I was visting my daughter who is attending the University of San Diego for the Thanksgiving holiday. I live in New Engalnd so it was great to get away from the cold NE weather. A beautiful view from our room..The pool and hot tub were great. The staff was wonderful.. Will visit again for sure!!! Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: rjw35
Reviews.Content: We found a great "Bed and Breakfast" package for $75 per room. This included a $32 credit in the restaurant ($16 for 2 adults). We had steak and eggs ($12.95) for breakfast. As you can see, the credit will get you plenty of food - and good food. The hotel had two pools and two hot tubs. The newer pool and hot tub overlooked the marina and were very nice. The other two weren't bad, but nothing special. There was a great sidewalk to walk along the waterfront. The hotel had boat and waverunner rentals. The rooms had a sliding glass door that opened to a small patio with chairs and a table. The rooms we stayed in (304 and 312) we very dated. They had many holes in the wall that had been repaired, some stains on the popcorn ceiling, stained carpet, etc. It was clean though. The rooms also had a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. It was a short walk away from Sea World. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, high quality, exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: RandBSpokane
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip through AAA and sought out a 4-star hotel. We weâ€™re surprised at the value of the Dana. The Dana is located right off the entrance to Sea World. When we arrived I had believed my reservation was for a bay view. It was nit and I was kindly up-sold a bay view mini suite for an additional 35-40 bucks which I was fine with. I have to tell you, the section we weâ€™re in was newly remodeled. It was literally perfect. I would like to think we have a pretty discriminating eye for quality and we weâ€™re pretty taken back and thrilled by our room and view. The shutters on the windows werenâ€™t all that great but everything else was great. No cutting corners on anything. Exceptional linens, bathroom amenities, comfortable quality furniture. Let me not forget the employees at this establishment. Everyone from the front desk staff to maintenance personnel weâ€™re well groomed, in neat uniforms and very gracious, respectful and professional. We ate dinner at the bar and sat outside. It was an awesome evening, great service (didnâ€™t over or under serve) and the food was mush higher quality than we expected. They must have a very serious chef. Portion sizes weâ€™re smaller which we appreciated. After dinner we took a nice walk around the paved path around the bay and marina. It was perfect. We also took a short 5 minute drive over the bridge to the ocean. Parking was easy and everyone was friendly and we felt very comfortable walking the beach. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “More than we Imagined”
Reviews.Author: FatallyLost
Reviews.Content: Just looking for a hotel for the night, went to a show down at the college. The Dana looked good, decent prices so we booked it. The view, the room itself, everything was more than we had thought it'd have been. It was a great start to a truly amazing day. Next time I'm staying over in SD, I'm definitely looking to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryGill
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 10 day California vacation (3 days San Diego, 7 days Anaheim) with our 3 children (7 year old boy, 5 and 2 year old girls). We stayed at the Dana for the 3 nights in San Diego and found it fantastic. We stayed in the newer section and found the rooms large and well laid out, with a great view of the harbor. Our room had a pull-out sofa bed and we found it had plenty of room for the 5 of us. When we booked, they had a fantastic "american breakfast" deal on their website (up to $15 per adult guest towards breakfast each day for $17/day) and I don't think it could have been better. The breakfasts each day at the on-site Blue Pearl restaurant were cooked perfectly, and served by very pleasant and efficient staff. The hotel is very conveniently located within a 5 minute drive of Sea World (the primary reason we were visiting San Diego). The only negative is that the outdoor pool could have been warmer, but as we were travelling in January it was a bit cool for swimming anyways. We did enjoy the hot tub however. All in all, it was a fantastic stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view with great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vescobar29
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a beautiful place to stay. They have a newer side to the hotel and an older side. The older side is not "old" per say, but it isnt as shiny as the new side. They have 2 jacuzzi's and 2 heated pools. The hotel maintance crew is amazing and will do anything to accomodate you. The registration people are friendly and helpful. I loved the view. It is breath taking. You have the marina with a bridge in the background. You can stare at the view at night from the jacuzzi. I will be sure to stay at this place again if i visit san diego again. great place, great people, great view, great time. i would add pictures but i am at work but the pictures on this website are exactly correct to life of what the hotel looks like

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and pricing”
Reviews.Author: MarcusDolby
Reviews.Content: This place can hardly be beat for the money ($98 per night in December). Not only is it in a great location, right on the Marina, but the rooms were clean and they had a great restaurant (Firefly). Customer service was above average for sure. My only critical comments would include that they might benefit from having more than one computer for use in their lobby. That's about it. The rooms are clean, but slightly small (we were in their smallest room). I would definitely stay here again. It's also close to the 8 and the 5.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: akd4043
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 10 nights at the Dana and we can't say enough good things about the hotel. We were to stay only 3 nights, but got food poisoning at Sea World and ended up having to cancel our 7-day Mexican cruise, and stayed on at the Dana to recuperate and then try and make something out of our remaining days in San Diego and we were so glad to be at the Dana for the whole time. Very helpful front staff. Courteous shuttle bus drivers. The hotel concierge, the very sweet and helpful Suzanne, arranged for the hotel doctor to come in to see us, and she brought us ginger ale and tea. She helped arrange a car rental and gave good restaurant recommendations when we felt better. When we were sick, the complete bedding had to be changed 4 times - blankets, pillows, etc., due to us being so sick, and housekeeping did not gripe once. Even the maintenance guy who had to plunge the toilet, and the guy who had to come and scrub the carpet were very pleasant. All of the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, including at the Blue Pearl restaurant and Firefly lounge. Beautiful setting with palm trees, 2 very clean pools, lots of pool towels, clean laundry room, very good housekeeping, nice toiletries in room. Very tasty meals at both restaurants - not the same old restaurant thing at all. Easy public walkway in front of the property over to the bridge over to parks, beaches, etc. Our first room was on the first floor with marina view in older building. The last 3 nights, we upgraded to bigger room in new building - lovely unit as well. California shutters everywhere. Very relaxing and beautiful setting. Very quiet rooms, both of them.... We can't wait to return, and hopefully go on that cruise after all. We didn't know San Diego was so beautiful. The hotel is ideally located, but you need a car to get to a grocery store, or farther afield like the Zoo. Highly recommend the zoo and Legoland if you have little ones. Expensive entry prices though, including at SeaWorld which is very close and within walking distance. For a trip that was ruined due to strawberry fruit smoothies at SeaWorld, the Dana felt like a safe harbour when we were so ill so far away from home (4 days of terrible illness) and we were thankful that we were able to make the rest of our time in San Diego memorable for the right reasons - the Dana had a huge hand in doing that for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: jsantos97
Reviews.Content: The Dana provided the perfect hotel for a weekend getaway to Sea World. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. They have two restaurants on site. Blue Pearl was fantastic with a wide range of menu items and great prices. Firefly has a smaller menu but the food was great. However, the prices are high and the portions are very small. They offered a happy hour but it was barely $1.50 off the drinks. They also offer a weekly calendar of fun events to attend on site. They offer a shuttle service from the airport, Amtrack & Sea World. Tip - if you want to go to Gas Lamp, the driver can drop you at the Amtrack and it's only a few blocks walk (this saves you the $25 cab fare) They have an inexpensive bike/boat rental on site and offers a bike path that takes you along the bay. Very nice during the sunset. Note that it's about a 15 minute bike ride to Mission Beach and they can provide you with bike locks. I would hands down recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Attended as part of wedding, great location, poor management”
Reviews.Author: FreqBusinessTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a wedding party. The hotel is in a beautiful location in San Diego. The hotel has two sections, an older section built in 1960's and new section built a few years ago. Definitely stay in the new section (bay view rooms) as the older section did not look good. The hotel rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Our problems were with the management. -Charges on room service menu do not match what is charged. -Elevators constantly out of service (we had a disabled family member visting the bride's suite stuck) & we had difficulty getting someone to help fix elevator. -Air conditioning went out in building. We were told someone would be right by but they never came to our room. Along with others in party, we had to call 3-4 times each to get someone to fix it. -Air conditioning event was repeated the next night. -No one checked out the sound system before the ceremony (hotel's responsibility) and it ruined the event (squeaked and crackled the whole time until someone finally turned it off) -Held an outdoor cocktail hour before reception, but they only had two heat lamps (50+ people) and everyone was very uncomfortable. When we asked if they had more, they said that was all they had. We asked to be let into the ballroom and they would not let us in. -Bride's mother had jewelry in safe and it would not open. Maintenance confirmed that the master codes would not open it and it was broken. We had to raise a complete fuss to get someone to cut it open. They did not want to do anything until we yelled at the manager. The hotel staff was not very apologetic. We were not very happy, would never return and would not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Gammydodger
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a hotwire deal 1 night plus 2 days car rental for $200 - pretty good value. The hotel is older with motel style rooms. Beautiful setting on the bay, was a little worried that the room may not be in such good condition, however, I was pleasantly surprised - it felt like I was somewhere tropical, the furniture was charming, the room well appointed. Internet connection was good, staff were friendly enough - I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Mission Bay Area”
Reviews.Author: lindyluwho
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at The Dana on Mission Bay. This hotel is low key and very nice. We had booked a Bay View room, which we would recommend. The other parts of the complex appear quite old. Although, we never seen what the "older" accommodations looked like. Our room faced the bay which was beautiful and very relaxing and quiet when we were in our room. We ate a couple of times at the hotel restaurants. One is the Blue Pearl and is casual dining. Ok food and staff very friendly. The other being The Firefly, excellent food and again very nice staff. The Dana is very close to Sea world. You could walk, (probably about 15-20 min to the entrance of Sea world). The Dana also has a shuttle to take you there if you are not inclined to walk or don't have a car. Miission Beach/Belmont Park (wooden Roller Coaster) is about 5 min away by car. Huge wide beach. You can rent bikes to ride along the boardwalk. Which we did and it was a lot of fun. There are seafood restaurants on the boardwalk that were very good. We ate at the World Famous. Excellent food. Don't let the decor turn you off. There is so much to do in and around the San Diego area and with the weather being very pleasant you can plan something to do every day. We had a wonderful holiday and would recommend the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Hagop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the recommendation of a friend. The pictures on the website made it look so tropical and beautiful, which it was, but not to the degree I expected. On the positive side: the location is great, right on Mission Bay, beautiful views, lovely landscape, and close to many attractions. Mission Beach & Belmont Park are nearby, of course Sea World, Cabrillo Monument is a short drive, and the downtown area was only about 10 minutes away. The staff were helpful and friendly, the restaurant was fine. There are two pools, but I would recommend the one by the Firefly lounge as it was much nicer. Negative: I was disappointed with the room. We stayed in the Marina cove and as someone pointed out here, the room was very tight. There were four of us in the room (2 adults, 2 children) and it seemed like we were constantly bumpling into one another. The bed was not very comfortable, and it could get a little noisy when people walked by outside. We went during the off-season, so the rate wasn't too bad. I think had I paid more during the Summer I would have been far more disappointed. Overall, a nice stay, but keep your expectations low.

Reviews.Title: “This place is unbelievable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rphwanab77
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond words. My husband and I stayed in downtown San Diego for my business trip at a very nice hotel. We stayed over an extra night at The Dana to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary and get out of the bustle of the city after the business trip was over. First of all, they upgraded our room to the best suite in the place because it was our anniversary. I mentioned it in the comments when I booked on their site. It was the most unbelievable experience. We rented a kayak and spent 4 hours touring around the area and seeing sea lions up close. We booked a couples message that was great but the spa facilities have something to be desired. All in all, we enjoyed ourselves VERY MUCH and would return to this place in a heartbeat. Some suggestions: - The Blue Pearl restaurant had great service and excellent food. There was outside dining that overlooked the marina and allows you to sit out and see fireworks at Sea World while you enjoy your dinner. PROBLEM: It should be located somewhere else than right by the pool. It was a little too close to families enjoying a night swim with their children. - When making your reservation, try to book in the newer section. We walked around and found out that some of the cheaper rooms were in an older section of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost wonderful”
Reviews.Author: patabove
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in a Bay view room. The room was quite spacious; it was spotless, and housekeeping did a great job every day. The bathroom was a good size, too. Having a mini-kitchen (fridge, microwave, sink and cabinet storage) was very convenient, since we like to keep snacks on hand. And the bedding was comfortable. The decor was on the dark side, the only thing that detracted from the room. Although we did have a good view of the bay, we were disappointed that we could also see the main road in the distance, but there wasn't much traffic. We liked the location. It was out of the city, but anything we wanted to see was just 7 or 8 miles away, or less. Although we probably won't get back to San Diego, we would definitely recommend a bayview room at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought”
Reviews.Author: Northbrook
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October 2008. My husband booked it and I must admit to not having read TripAdvisor reviews beforehand, so maybe our disappointment was our own fault..... The hotel website shows lovely rooms, so I was quite surprised when we drove in to what appeared to be a fairly ramshackle site. Our room was in one of the older buildings, admittedly facing the marina, but opening on to a public walkway (which we had assumed would be divided into private balconies). The whole room shook every time anyone walked by and noise was a constant problem, especially at the weekend. You make a choice between privacy and natural light - if you want the latter you must have the wooden shutters open but the world and his wife can look in as they walk past. Also the walls are very thin and we could hear conversations in the next room. The bed was comfortable enough but facing it was a huge cupboard, half TV cabinet and half wardrobe; with the doors open for either function, it was impossible to walk past the bed. Off the bedroom was a space containing a double sink unit but there was no door for privacy - do I want to watch my other half brushing his teeth, or vice versa? Then off this space was the bathroom with toilet and bath, thankfully with a door. The air conditioning was incredibly noisy. It would start up like a rocket motor, clatter away and then stop altogether till the next time - like Chinese water torture if you let it bother you. We asked to move to the new block with private balconies, but they could only offer us one overlooking 'parkland' i.e. a strip of green separating the hotel from the road and for 4 nights only, so we stayed where we were. Our breakfasts were included to the tune of $15 each at the Blue Pearl, and not once could we reach this total. Hearty is the word that comes to mind! On our first night we ate at the more upmarket on-site Firefly restaurant and had a disastrous encounter with a waitress which left us feeling like we'd been part of street theatre or a 'happening' by the end of the meal. This put us off till our last night when we ventured back and to our relief were served by a very nice young man - and the meal was good as well. We were glad we kept our rental car for the duration of our stay, as it would have been hard to get around by public transport. However, we didn't like being presented with the parking charge when we checked out - not mentioned on any previous occasion. There was free computer access in the lobby, which was a bonus, and people were very good about keeping to the requested 10 minute limit if there was a queue. If we return to San Diego, I would not stay here again. The marina location is very pleasant, but there are no shops or cafes close by, and we were not interested in Sea World, which seems to be the main attraction for families. I would prefer to be somewhere with better facilities and nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana”
Reviews.Author: travelingtwoxtwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We were very pleased with the hotel and the nearby restaurant (The Blue Pearl). Our room had a view of Mission Bay and The Dana's own boat launch and dock. It was beautiful! We will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms if you pay for premium suites but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Kaismommy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at The Dana with our 15 month old toddler. Although we went to San Diego for the zoo, the location was nice. We got the corner Premium Bay View Suite with king size bed (room 2320). We got there early but they were able to check us in early, which was nice. I guess they weren't that busy since it's no longer summer. Having an active toddler we liked the size of the room. He loved going out on the balcony, opening and closing the sliding door. Having a mini fridge and wet bar was also convenient because I was able to keep all of his snacks in there. On to the complaints: When I made the reservation, I requested a crib. When I checked in (at 1:30pm), I let them know that we requested a crib-they said they'll come set it up. We went to Balboa Park, came back around 5pm and still no crib. Called the guest service and 30 min later, they brought it. It wasn't a crib, it was a small pack and play. (which my son doesn't sleep too well in) The king size bed was really bouncy and uncomfortable. My husband and I were tossing and turning and every time one of us moved, the other will bounce up and down and get woken up. After tossing and turning for 2 hours, I finally went to the couch and slept there. They didn't have any extra blankets or sheets in the room so I slept without anything over me. The air conditioning system was LOUD. I mean LOUD. If you have it on auto, it makes a HUGE clicking noise whenever it turns on. I was so worried that it would wake up our baby, I turned it off but then it got really humid so I turned it back on. Even thought we were in the newer part of the hotel and in the corner, it has no sound proofing system so you can hear the music from the pool/restaurant area and there was some weird noise all night. I think it was the elevator. The sound traveled down the hallway and right at the end of the hallway was our room and when you open the door, that's where the bed is. Bad design to have a bed right in front of the door. Every time someone slams the door, you get woken up. (and you can only close the door by slamming it since the door knob doesn't turn) If you order room service, be ware that they include gratuity already plus a $2 service fee. I wasn't paying attention to it so I totally over tipped them. The restaurants were good but felt a bit pricey for the quality of the food. Had much better dinner across the street at Red Marlin at The Hyatt. So basically, we paid extra to get a nice upgraded room but I ended up sleeping on the couch for 2 nights while my husband tossed and turned on the uncomfortable bed. I only stayed at The Dana because they had the suites at a fairly reasonable price. Should have stayed at Omni instead. I had a much better experience at Omni last time I visited San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience, View, Customer Service, etc...”
Reviews.Author: sellscience
Reviews.Content: Great facility with excellent views of San Diego's Mission Bay. Best quality food thru room service I've ever eaten. Pools were heated which was great for the kids, plus on Friday night at one of the pools the played a Disney movie (Little Mermaid) which was a great treat. Within walking distance to Sea World (10 minutes) but they also offered free shuttles... Plus a lot of open space and grass if you have younger children that need to run around.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ackelley44
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with the Dana and would be fine staying there again. Here are a few points: POSITIVE: - Location, location, location = we did some jogging around the harbor and spent most of our time on the beach, so the location was perfect. We didn't go to Sea World, but if you want to go there you can take the free shuttle from the hotel. - Pool / spa = neatly kept and perfect for relaxing - Price = we paid $70 per night on priceline which is far below full price and even below a regular Holiday Inn type hotel in the area AVERAGE - Room was pretty small, but you get what you pay for. I've seen reviews in which people were disgusted by the "older" section of the hotel and were upset they had to pay $60 to upgrade to an ocean view. If that's the case, then book direct and pay full price. We were willing to have the older section and a "motel" type room in order to save money. - Refrigerator in the room was nice NEGATIVE - Weight room = for someone who spends a lot of time working out, the place was almost non-existent. These days hotels seem to feel that putting a treadmill in a small room with mirrors qualifies as a weight room. - Movie access = we always enjoy watching movies on vacation. The room had no DVD player. We brought a portable of our own and had no way to plug it in. When we asked about it at the front desk, they said it wasn't possible, but that we could purchase movies directly on our TV. We looked into it, but the selections were minimal and it was $12 per movie! - Parking was $12 per night. We were told when we called ahead that parking was free, but apparently not for priceline customers. Even with the addition of the parking we paid $82 per night, so we can't complain, but it was an unpleasant surprise. All in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: mav04
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I my wife and I just got back from staying at the Dana. We were there from Sept. 6 - Sept. 10. We had asked to be placed in the newer section of the hotel, with a king bed. We were told no problem once we booked our stay. We check in at the lobby, get our room key, and head to our room. As we get there, you can tell from the outside this was not the newer section of the hotel and looked more like a cheap motel building. We open the door to our room and what do you know, NO king bed. There were two queen beds instead! Unbelievable! The room also had a bad distinct smell that would not go away. We call front desk and they tell us nothing can be done about it, that all the rooms in the newer section were booked. Strangely enough, they tell us they could put us in the newer section the next day (Sun. Sept. 7) for an extra $60 a night. We said forget it and wrote an email to the general manager. We put up staying in that old, nasty room for two nights. And since the walls and ceilings were so thin, we could hear every conversation and foot steps all around us. On Sept. 8, we got a call from the supervisor (I believe her name was Vanessa), saying they got our email and would like to put us in the newer room with the king bed for no additional cost. Of course we took it, and we were able to spend our last two remaining nights in the room we had requested. The differences between both rooms were night and day. After this whole experience, we are grateful we got to spend at least half of our vacation in the room we wanted, but because of all the trouble we went through, I cannot recommend this hotel. Therefore, we will not be staying at the Dana again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Dana”
Reviews.Author: NEEDLES75
Reviews.Content: Superb location in itself and within the San Diego area. Impecable external accomodations (gardens, parking, 2 pools with one really perfect). Room : value for money. Choice of two restaurants, the Firefly with an elaborate menu. Being Mediteranean, I simply found the expressos could be improved ! Perfect fo visit Seaworld of course but as well to enjoy the beach. Our 3rd stay there and looking forward to the 4th.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: AllisonHouston
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the website or misled by the room titles. This is a dumpy old motel. At least the original part of the property is. I can't speak to the three story rooms. I requested a poolside room so that my kids could be near their friends who were also going. While you could see the pool from the room if you stood up to look over the pool, there is no access to the pool nor a balcony overlooking the pool. The only rooms with poolside access are called something else. This is possibly the most depressing hotel room I have ever stayed in. We stayed upstairs two nights (trapped in this bad box) and then downstairs for several more. We could hear every step our upstairs neighbors took. These outdated buidlings need to be torn down and a new one built. While the location is good if you plan to go to Seaworld or have a boat docked at the marina, few of these rooms even face the water. The restaurant with a view of the water would have been nice had it not been for the fact that the grounds had been doused with insecticide that morning. The smell was unbearable. We had to retreat inside. The one redeeming feature of the place were the margaritas at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaR27
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Dana this August. I was a little concerned because I had read the hotel was under renovation but you would never know it. I called to make sure I booked a renovated room and was assured that I did. From the moment we arrived we just loved it. The staff was great. Everyone we encountered was so nice and would stop whatever they were doing to help us. The firefly restaurant is really cute. We went there for breakfast each morning. It can be a little pricey but well worth it. We didn't get the chance to try their other restaurant but heard it was good also. About our room..if possible book a Bay View Room as we did. The view is terrific!! The rooms are very spacious, the bathroom is BEAUTIFUL and you have a balcony facing the bay. The housekeeping service was on point and the property itself is super clean. The hotel's location is great too. Seaworld is literally walking distance. They are very close to Mission Beach which is really nice and downtown is like a 10 minute car ride. Parking is $12 per day at the hotel which we were a little surprised by. We live in NYC so we aren't complaining but we just weren't expecting it. My fiance and I both agree we would stay here again. It isn't ideal for young single people but for couples and families it is perfect. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Only about the Location”
Reviews.Author: mytravels08
Reviews.Content: The Location is Amazing but that's pretty much it. We arrrived at 3:15 pm and told the room wasn't quite ready but guaranteed by 4pm. The lead explains to me what kind of room I reserved but tells me I've been upgraded to a "garden view"...then he says if it were more convenient for me, he would call my cell when the room was ready. I agreed. I was told earlier on the phone that we could use the amenities on the property if the room was not ready. We decided to take a stroll around the Marina and LOVED it. After about 30 minutes we decided it was getting hot and maybe we should ask for a key to use the pool. I go in and check to get a key for the pool and see if the room is ready....still not ready. 4:20pm rolls by and I Never got a phone call...I go in again and check to see if the room's ready...STILL NOT READY. Mind you...we were GUARANTEED the room by 4pm. I don't make a fuss I just let it go. The woman at the front desk is helpful but slow, its her second day on the job. She explains that we could either stay in "the same kind of room" that I reserved right now or if I want to wait a few minutes to be in the "upgraded garden view" room. A few seconds rolls by and VWALLA the upgraded room is ready! We walk upstairs to our room, open the door, and Boom...Our view is nothing but a bunch of oversized banana leaves blocking our ENTIRE window...No view here. I also notice there is no central air...but I convince myself that its an "island feel" and that the wall air conditioner will do fine. We decide to finally head down to the pool. We get in and I notice little particles floating in the pool but I ignore it...must be just dirt. Then we notice Hair floating...don't mind it. Okay, more hair and more hair and more hair...all kinds....blond, short, black, bunched up. My toddler is swimming with us so my husband says..."I'm getting really grossed out now, can we get out now?" So we get out. Before we leave he wants a drink. We order a Long Island...close to 8 oz...IT 11 DOLLARS. Okay, whatever we are on vacation. Go back to the room as my son is eating his cookie it falls to the ground, my husband GRABS it from him because he notices a hair on it....I look in closer, ITS PUBIC HAIR...(Blond). Let me tell y ou, we AREN'T BLONDS! I think I have said enough...Oh and btw, I also noticed the SAME male lead who I thought wasn't too bad, make faces and treat a customer without respect....It was such a turn off...It made the DANA just go down the drain for me. Oh and one more thing...the bathroom we had, the shower was kinda moldy...the orange mold. That's it. Good luck with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pollockwood
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel!! Close enough to walk to Sea World, even tho they do provide free shuttle service. 2 GREAT pools. Rooms were nice sized with fridge and microwave. They even have a clothes line in the bathroom to hang those wet clothes. Right on the marina with bike/boat/paddle boat/jet ski rentals. Plenty of room to let the kids run off that excess energy. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. All the staff encountered were pleasant, willing to assist and above all professional. They also proved washers and dryers at $1.50 a load, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: elsaontario
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated my sonâ€™s 6th birthday at Sea World and instead of driving home we stayed at The Dana. The hotel is very nice with a beautiful view of mission bay. We had our own little semi-private patio area with a view of the pool and a grass area. Mind you we were traveling with four kids under the age of 6 years old and 2 seniors. This hotel was very well liked. A little more then I wanted to spend, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service!”
Reviews.Author: fapa_usa
Reviews.Content: After staying at The Dana in 2005 we were very happy to find a great offer for High Season this year, so we canceled an already booked Hotel and switched to The Dana. In 2005 we were very satisfied with the Hotel's service, but since our last stay a few things changed....The booking of our stay was already complicated, we first got two wrong confirmations, so we tried to contact the Hotel three times, but they were too busy and never came back to us! Like other guests we also were wondering about the parking fee they charge, which seems to be invented after 2005 (12 Dollars per day!!!). But we still were looking forward to our stay. After our first night the housekeeping forgot to prepare our room, if this would have been happen once, we wouldn't mind, but this happened three times during our five days stay and we had to call the reception every time! Instead of an excuse we just got the info, that this is normal if there is a "Privacy please" sign outside or that the housekeeping will take care in the afternoon - unfortunately we removed the signs after 10 am and usually came back in the evening to our room. So for people who very appreciate cleaning on time we can't recommend The Dana. Beside the Housekeeping the reception staff was also less friendly than 3 years before and because of the new invented "Pool parties" and "Cocktail Happy Hours" the other guests changed enormously, so for example we avoid the tropical Pool thanks to dizzy guests or awakened on our last night when a drunken guy were banging and slamming the door next to our room and screamed on his wife (?) to get excess. As a result we will look for a another Hotel for our next San Diego stay.

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: ohiotravelerabc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at The Dana and had a wonderful experience. We appreciated the free shuttle to and from the airport, cruise terminal, and Sea World. There is also a bus line directly in front of the hotel so it was easy and inexpensive to go downtown. The concierge was very friendly and helped us arrange an Old Town Trolley tour that picked us up at the hotel. The hotel has 2 very nice pools and spas. The two restaurants and room service were excellent. We'd definitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana on Mission Bay was a lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: KittyKent
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 and a half weeks in California. We stayed for our first 5 nights in the Dana and were very impressed with everything there. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The food at both restaurants was lovely. We enjoyed both pools and found the whole experience a very nice introduction to America as this was our first visit. Breakfast at the Firefly was magnificent and snacks around the pool were very welcome too. Our room was spotless and very comfortable, overlooking the bay on the ground floor with a patio. It was handy having a fridge and a microwave in the room too. As far as location is concerned. It was great to be able to walk to Seaworld but we did obviously hire a car and were able to see the rest of San Diego whilst we were there. All in all a great experience and we would be very happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well equipped rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jmhols
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the older buildings in the hotel in a ground floor room with patio near the tropical pool. The upper floors had no balcony to sit out, so if in that part of the hotel I would recommend requesting a ground floor room. The rooms were spacious with a plasma tv, fridge and microwave. On arrival the receptionist on noting we were a family of 4 (with teenagers) in one room she looked for a larger room than we had been allocated which was appreciated.
